It is revealed that Molinari is anti-abortion even though his wife recently had an abortion. Jimmy Breslin reports that a former Molinari aide has stated Molinari's anti-gay remarks were to get back at his gay brother.
COMMERCIAL: Manatus Restaurant
4. Lou Maletta and Joe Manto, a specialist in water treatment, discuss cryptosporidium.
COMMERCIAL: Professional Plumbing, Specialists in Water Treatment Systems.

5. GLAAD Media Alert: Visa supports the Gay Games, which causes Pat Robertson to call on his followers to cut up their cards in protest. Businesses in the Midwest are trying to get Visa cards pulled from stores. AT&T runs an ad in The Advocate, leading to protests from the right. Viewers are encouraged to write to Visa and AT&T to counter the right's homophobia.
COMMERCIAL: The Monster
6. Lavender Health: Sexual assault is discussed. Bea Hanson of the Anti-Violence Project is interviewed.
COMMERCIAL: Urad Leather Cream ("You can treat me badâ¦ but you gotta treat your leather right.")
7. The Lambda Update: Amendment 2, which repealed gay rights in Colorado, is discussed. Suzanne B. Goldberg is interviewed.
COMMERCIAL: Suave Succubus at the Wings Theater

did.unittitle:
Gay USA, Vol. XII, Episode No. 43
[Air date: 10/27/1994]

dao.xlink:title: Gay USA, Vol. XII, Episode No. 43 [Air date: 10/27/1994]

daodesc.p: Gay USA, Vol. XII, Episode No. 43 [Air date: 10/27/1994]: October 1994

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: COMMERCIAL: Absolute Yacht Rental

1. News Notes: Jack Wrangler gets married. Charles Busch about to make stage debut as a man. Bob Grant radio show makes racist remarks. National Hemophilia Council facing lawsuits. Susan Molinari gets married to quash rumors that she is a lesbian. More evidence that Oliver North is gay. Andy Humm recommends Ed Wood.

2. At the New York Hilton, protests during a Pataki fundraiser. Protesters are interviewed. Donna Minkowitz, Jeannine Hakin, Vinnie Maniscalco among those interviewed outside. Al D'Amato, Marcus Duran, John Dunne, Dov Hikind, Roy Goodman (who repeatedly denies Pataki is against the civil rights bill), and Andrew Eristroff interviewed during the fundraiser by Andy Humm.
COMMERCIAL: Manatus Restaurant
3. Karen Burstein fundraiser. Marjorie Hill and Burstein are interviewed. Deborah Glick, Karen Burstein, and Tom Duane speak.
COMMERCIAL: Poz Magazine
4. Figure skating is shown.
COMMERCIAL: Naya Natural Spring Water
COMMERCIAL: Urad Leather Cream ("You can treat me badâ¦ but you gotta treat your leather right.")
5. Lavender Health: Assisted dying is covered. Tracy Miller of Task Force on Life and the Law, Senator Franz Leichter, and Carla Kerr are interviewed.
COMMERCIAL: Professional Plumbing, Specialists in Water Treatment Systems.

6. GLAAD Media Alert: The New York Times films a commercial with Rush Limbaugh endorsing them. Viewers are encouraged to write the Times and order they drop Limbaugh, withdraw the commercial, and publicly apologize.
COMMERCIAL: The Monster
7. Lou Maletta interviews Tom Murdock about his new play, Key West. A clip from the play is shown. Cynthia Moss, an actress in the play, is also interviewed.
COMMERCIAL: Heavenly Bodies, Circle Line Cruise Ship
COMMERCIAL: Suave Succubus at the Wings Theater

did.unittitle:
Gay USA, Vol. XII, Episode No. 44
[Air date: 11/3/1994]

dao.xlink:title: Gay USA, Vol. XII, Episode No. 44 [Air date: 11/3/1994]

daodesc.p: Gay USA, Vol. XII, Episode No. 44 [Air date: 11/3/1994]: November 1994

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: COMMERCIAL: Absolute Yacht Rental
COMMERCIAL: Manatus Restaurant

1. News Notes: Supreme Court refuses to hear case of gay man kicked out of army. ACT UP meeting goes badly amid declining membership and funding. New study reveals condom usage up among teens. Lily Tomlin comes out. The Republican party is overwhelmingly anti-gay. Oprah says gay men can't get to heaven. Unauthorized Marlon Brando biography alleges he was bisexual. Nancy Schaffer is assigned bodyguards after death threats.
COMMERCIAL: Naya Natural Spring Water

2. Local political round-up. Gay Men's Health Crisis reports on the candidates. Pataki refused to answer any polls conducted by GMHC. Herbert London is extremely homophobic. Karen Burstein's opponents accuse her of pedophilia.
COMMERCIAL: Poz Magazine

3. Damien Corboy interviewed about House and Senate races, which he says are in 'big trouble' of getting taken over by the Republicans. The Texas race with George Bush Jr. is discussed. Crown Prince of Denmark was seen walking out of gay book store.
COMMERCIAL: Professional Plumbing, Specialists in Water Treatment Systems.
4. Lambda Update: Catherine Hanssens is interviewed.
COMMERCIAL: The Monster
5. HomoXtra splits off part of their magazine into SX Magazine. Mark Berkley and Matthew Bank are interviewed.
COMMERCIAL: Urad Leather Cream ("You can treat me badâ¦ but you gotta treat your leather right.")
6. GLAAD Media Alert: Bob Grant of WABC makes homophobic and racist remarks, causing boycotts. Viewers are encouraged to write to WABC and demand Grant be dropped.
COMMERCIAL: Suave Succubus at the Wings Theater
7. Lavender Health: John Miller and Charles Kirtlew of Gay Circles are interviewed.

did.unittitle:
Gay USA, Vol. XII, Episode No. 45
[Air date: 11/10/1994]

dao.xlink:title: Gay USA, Vol. XII, Episode No. 45 [Air date: 11/10/1994]

daodesc.p: Gay USA, Vol. XII, Episode No. 45 [Air date: 11/10/1994]: November 1994

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: COMMERCIAL: Absolute Yacht Rental
COMMERCIAL: Manatus Restaurant

1. News Notes: Cancer drug being used for AIDS treatment. The BBC is making a Stonewall movie and the owner of the Stonewall bar is refusing to let them shoot there. Gay activists arrested and tortured in Albania. Anti-gay votes have cost over $180 million. Susan Smith and James R. Scott are covered. James Woods makes racist and homophobic remarks.
2. Election Night. Tom Duane, Deborah Glick, and Dick Dadey interviewed in the wake of Pataki's win. Karen Burstein speaks.
COMMERCIAL: Naya Natural Spring Water
COMMERCIAL: Poz Magazine
3. Andy Humm laments that the election results have put gay rights at a standstill.
COMMERCIAL: The Monster
4. Amit Kama, of the Society for the Protection of Personal Rights in Israel is interviewed.
COMMERCIAL: Professional Plumbing, Specialists in Water Treatment Systems.
5. Lavender Health: Marj Plumb, director of Lesbian Health at the Office of Gay and Lesbian Health is interviewed.
COMMERCIAL: Urad Leather Cream ("You can treat me badâ¦ but you gotta treat your leather right.")
6. GLAAD Media Alert: The New York Times article 'Gay and Black: A High-Wire Act' is praised. Viewers are encouraged to write The New York Times.
COMMERCIAL: Suave Succubus at the Wings Theater
7. Lou Maletta covers the production of Stonewall, a BBC film. A few of the cast and crew are interviewed including Christine Vachon, Guillermo Diaz, and Nigel Finch.

did.unittitle:
Gay USA, Vol. XII, Episode No. 46
[Air date: 11/17/1994]

dao.xlink:title: Gay USA, Vol. XII, Episode No. 46 [Air date: 11/17/1994]

daodesc.p: Gay USA, Vol. XII, Episode No. 46 [Air date: 11/17/1994]: November 1994

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: COMMERCIAL: Absolute Yacht Rental
COMMERCIAL: Manatus Restaurant

1. News Notes: Humm states Cardinal Ratzinger is the most rumored candidate to take over the position of Pope. Patsy Flemming is the new AIDS czar. Clips of Pedro Zamora on The Real World are shown, as is a speech on Zamora by Bill Clinton.
COMMERCIAL: Poz Magazine
2. Dick Dadey is interviewed about the aftermath of the '94 elections. A clip of Karen Burstein on NY1 is shown.
COMMERCIAL: Professional Plumbing, Specialists in Water Treatment Systems.
3. Damien Corboy discusses the national results of the '94 election. Newt Gingrich is discussed, as is his lesbian sister.
COMMERCIAL: Naya Natural Spring Water
4. Lavender Health: Amber Hollibaugh is interviewed.

5. GLAAD Media Alert: Donahue runs a 1-hour special on black homophobia including a black minister who stated he would rather march alongside the KKK than support gay rights. Viewers are encouraged to write to the executive producer of the Donahue show.
COMMERCIAL: Lou Maletta Announces How to Advertise on GCN
6. Lou Maletta interviews Ira Siff. A cliff is shown.
COMMERCIAL: The Monster

did.unittitle:
Gay USA, Vol. XII, Episode No. 47
[Air date: 11/24/1994]

dao.xlink:title: Gay USA, Vol. XII, Episode No. 47 [Air date: 11/24/1994]

daodesc.p: Gay USA, Vol. XII, Episode No. 47 [Air date: 11/24/1994]: November 1994

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: COMMERCIAL: Absolute Yacht Rental
COMMERCIAL: Naya Natural Spring Water

1. News Notes: Pennsylvania becomes the most Republican state. Serial killer of gay men is on the FBI's 10 most wanted. Jeremy Gerard of Variety makes homophobic statements. New York Daily News continuing to fight against woman who was raped in Prospect Park.
2. Are We Surviving?: At the Gay and Lesbian Community Center. Gabriel Rotello of Newsday and Michelangelo Signorile interviewed.
COMMERCIAL: Professional Plumbing, Specialists in Water Treatment Systems.
3. Jerry Nadler is interviewed about the election aftermath.
COMMERCIAL: The Monster
4. Lou Maletta interviews Paulette Jacobson and Tony Ferrante, authors of Letters from the Closet.
COMMERCIAL: Manatus Restaurant
5. Lavender Health: Walt Odets and Marj Plumb speak at the American Association of Physicians for Human Rights Symposium.
COMMERCIAL: Lou Maletta Announces How to Advertise on GCN
6. Lambda Update: Beatrice Dohrn discusses the Joe Steffan case.
7. GLAAD Media Alert: Several gay and lesbian characters featured on network TV. Viewers are encouraged to write to the producers of Sisters.
8. Marilyn Cooper of PFLAG is interviewed about an anti-gay travel company, Travel and Leisure.

did.unittitle:
Gay USA, Vol. XII, Episode No. 48
[Air date: 12/1/1994]

dao.xlink:title: Gay USA, Vol. XII, Episode No. 48 [Air date: 12/1/1994]

daodesc.p: Gay USA, Vol. XII, Episode No. 48 [Air date: 12/1/1994]: December 1994

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: COMMERCIAL: Absolute Yacht Rental
COMMERCIAL: Manatus Restaurant

1. News Notes: Ban on gays in the military upheld. Newt Gingrich mentioned. Crackdown on sexually oriented businesses in New York. Jesse Helms in trouble. Guy Molinari admits if he had not made anti-gay remarks, Karen Burstein would have been elected. Slide for Pride '95 announced.
2. GMHC AIDS Danceathon: Rosie Perez, Salt n Pepa, and Queen Latifah perform.
COMMERCIAL: Professional Plumbing, Specialists in Water Treatment Systems.
3. Ed Anderson reports on the victory party for Sheila James Kuehl, the first open lesbian in the California assembly. John Heilman, Sheila James Kuehl interviewed.
COMMERCIAL: Naya Natural Spring Water
4. The Lambda Update: Joseph Steffan case covered by Beatrice Dohrn. (repeat from 429)
COMMERCIAL: The Monster
5. Jerry Nadler is interviewed about the election aftermath. (repeat from 429)
COMMERCIAL: Coming Out Workshop Presented by PFLAG at the Lesbian and Gay Community Center
6. Lavender Health: Frank Carbone of Body Positive is interviewed.
COMMERCIAL: Urad Leather Cream featuring Lou Maletta
7. Interview with Arthur Kirson. He performs at The Green Room.
COMMERCIAL: Poz Magazine
8. GLAAD Media Alert: The New York Times' election coverage is praised. Viewers are encouraged to write to the Times.
9. GCN Seattle Washington: Deborah Glick, Kyle Rae, Patrick Hogan, Bob Gentry, Michael Spencer speak.

did.unittitle:
Gay USA, Vol. XII, Episode No. 49
[Air date: 12/8/1994]

dao.xlink:title: Gay USA, Vol. XII, Episode No. 49 [Air date: 12/8/1994]

daodesc.p: Gay USA, Vol. XII, Episode No. 49 [Air date: 12/8/1994]: December 1994

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: COMMERCIAL: Absolute Yacht Rental
COMMERCIAL: Manatus Restaurant

1. News Notes: National Lesbian and Gay Taskforce gets new director, Linda Paras. Anti-gay legislation continues. Rudy Giuliani gets a new nickname, 'Rudolph the Redneck Mayor' due to gutting of AIDS services. Newt Gingrich is asked on "Meet the Press" if he supports gays.
COMMERCIAL: Professional Plumbing, Specialists in Water Treatment Systems.

2. Unveiling of the 'Red Ribbons Are Nice' campaign on World AIDS Day. Kenneth Cole is interviedwed. Lou Maletta reports from the Body Shop and interviews Bill Exeros. At the Metropolitan Museum of Art, Fred Davey gives a speech on Day Without Art. Dale Hogan reports from inside the Met. The NYPLPA is also shown, as is the Latino Community Names Project. Charles King is interviewed. Candlelight Vigil with speech by Brent Nicholson-Earl. The vigil march is shown.
COMMERCIAL: Poz Magazine
3. The passing of Elizabeth Glaser and Andy Kopkind covered.
COMMERCIAL: Naya Natural Spring Water

4. Andy Garcia taking on role of gay poet in Spanish Civil War. Filmmakers Brian Sloan, director of Pool Days and Raoul O'Connor, director of Friend of Dorothy are interviewed. Clips from these films and The Disco Years are shown.
COMMERCIAL: The Monster
5. Lavender Health: Ravinia Hayes-Cozier is interviewed.
COMMERCIAL: Urad Leather Cream featuring Lou Maletta
6. GLAAD Media Alert: Jerry Springer show viciously attacks transsexual adolescent. Viewers are encouraged to write the show.
7. GCN Special Report: Pataki tries to rescind health benefits for gays and lesbians.

did.unittitle:
Gay USA, Vol. XII, Episode No. 50
[Air date: 12/15/1994]

dao.xlink:title: Gay USA, Vol. XII, Episode No. 50 [Air date: 12/15/1994]

daodesc.p: Gay USA, Vol. XII, Episode No. 50 [Air date: 12/15/1994]: December 1994

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: COMMERCIAL: Absolute Yacht Rental
COMMERCIAL: Manatus Restaurant

1. News Notes: Linda Paras is questioned for her management problems. George Pataki trying to get rid of domestic partnership benefits. Jesse Helms knocks ornaments of cherubs off a Christmas tree, referring to them as 'child pornography'. Dolly Parton says she would have been 'a drag queen' had she been born a man.
2. Dick Dadey interviewed about George Pataki and the Pride Agenda meeting in Albany.
COMMERCIAL: Professional Plumbing, Specialists in Water Treatment Systems.

3. 25th anniversary of the Gay Activists Alliance. Rich Wandel, Lew Todd, Allen Roskoff, Mark Rubin, Pete Fisher, Charles Silverstein, Michael Lavery, Don Teal, Joe Kennedy, Rose Jordan, Ron Gold, Randy Wicker, and John Paul Hudson interviewed.
COMMERCIAL: Poz Magazine
4. Mark Blasius, author of Lesbian and Gay Politics, is interviewed.
COMMERCIAL: Naya Natural Spring Water
5. Lou Maletta interviews Martha Wash, the singer for "It's Raining Men", about a large-size clothing line she's launching.
COMMERCIAL: The Monster
6. Lavender Health: Part 2 of interview with Ravinia Hayes-Cozier.
COMMERCIAL: Urad Leather Cream featuring Lou Maletta

7. The Lambda Update: Suzanne Goldberg discusses anti-gay initiatives post-election. 8. GLAAD Media Alert: The Wall Street Journal runs article on Republicans backing down from anti-gay biases. Viewers are encouraged to write to Robert Bartley of the Journal.

did.unittitle:
Gay USA, Vol. XII, Episode No. 51
[Air date: 12/22/1994]

dao.xlink:title: Gay USA, Vol. XII, Episode No. 51 [Air date: 12/22/1994]

daodesc.p: Gay USA, Vol. XII, Episode No. 51 [Air date: 12/22/1994]: December 1994

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: COMMERCIAL: Absolute Yacht Rental
COMMERCIAL: Manatus Restaurant

1. News Notes: Republicans trying to defund PBS. The Advocate runs into trouble over a bonus. ABC drops My So-Called Life. In Ireland, reverend Lee Cosgrove dies of a heart attack at a gay sauna and is given last rites by two priests who just happened to be there. Maya Angelou has cancelled several college visits because of a run-in with Fred Phelps.
2. Brad Williams interviews Aduato Belarmino Alves.
3. Happy Holidays bumper.
COMMERCIAL: Professional Plumbing, Specialists in Water Treatment Systems.
4. Happy Holidays bumper 2.
5. Bob Kingdom of The Truman Capote Talk Show is interviewed. A few clips are shown.
6. Happy Holidays bumper 3.
COMMERCIAL: Poz Magazine
7. Happy Holidays bumper 4.
8. AIDS News: Vaccine trials begin outside the US.
9. Happy Holidays bumper 5.
COMMERCIAL: Naya Natural Spring Water
10. Happy Holidays bumper 6.
11. Lavender Health: An excerpt from Having Fun Never Has to End is shown, as well as interview with Arbert Santana of GMHC and House of Latex.
COMMERCIAL: The Monster
12. Happy Holidays bumper 7.
13. GLAAD Media Alerts: Victor/Victoria is brought to Broadway. One song featured homophobic lyrics. GLAAD informed Blake Edwards, who reworked the song and removed the offending lyrics.
14. Happy Holidays bumper 8.
COMMERCIAL: Urad Leather Cream featuring Lou Maletta
15. Happy Holidays bumper 9.
16. DIFFA celebrates 10th Anniversary. Angela Cummings and Rosemary Kuropat interviewed.
17. Happy Holidays bumper 10.
COMMERCIAL: KISS 142 West 10th Street.
18. Happy Holidays bumper 11.

did.unittitle:
Gay USA, Vol. XII, Episode No. 52
[Air date: 12/29/1994]

dao.xlink:title: Gay USA, Vol. XII, Episode No. 52 [Air date: 12/29/1994]

daodesc.p: Gay USA, Vol. XII, Episode No. 52 [Air date: 12/29/1994]: December 1994

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: COMMERCIAL: Absolute Yacht Rental
COMMERCIAL: Manatus Restaurant
COMMERCIAL: Kiss, West 10th Street
1. News Notes: Year in Review. Giuliani shuts out the gay community. Dali Lama comes out in favor of gay relationships. ACT UP protests Giuliani's first day (archive footage).
COMMERCIAL: Poz Magazine

2. William Hall appointed to head up AIDS research. Rueben Diaz' homophobic remarks. The Pope says gay families 'not real families'. Tom Hanks' Oscar speech for Philadelphia shown. Gay Mexican man granted political asylum in the US. Boston St. Patrick's Day Parade cancelled when organizers are told they have to include gay groups. The New York St. Patrick's Day Parade is shown. Interview with Billy Jean King shown. Interview by Andy Humm with George Pataki shown.
COMMERCIAL: Kiss, West 10th Street
COMMERCIAL: Naya Natural Spring Water

3. Gay Games IV and Stonewall 25 footage. Christine Gebby resigns as AIDS czar. Margret Kamilmeyer reinstated. Rush Limbaugh loses Florida Orange Juice endorsement. Gay Pride March in London shown. Jerry Nadler and Tom Duane interview shown. Woodstock '94 shown. Wigtsock is shown. Karen Burstein's run for attorney general covered, as is Guy Molinari's homophobic comments against her. Colorado's amendment 2 struck down. The Dada Ball is shown. Joycelyn Elders forced by Republicans to resign as surgeon general. World AIDS Day shown.
COMMERCIAL: The Monster
COMMERCIAL: Kiss, West 10th Street
4. The Lambda Update: Living wills covered. Catherine Hanssens interviewed.

5. GLAAD Media Update: My So-Called Life features a storyline where a young man is kicked out of his house for being gay. ABC is putting the show on hiatus. Viewers are encouraged to write to ABC to get the show saved.
6. Lavender Health: House of Latex Project covered.
COMMERCIAL: Urad Leather Cream featuring Lou Maletta
7. Names of people in the gay and lesbian community who died in 1994.

did.unittitle: 1995 Vol. XIII

Gay USA, Vol. XIII, Episode No. 1
[Air date: 1/5/1995]

dao.xlink:title: Gay USA, Vol. XIII, Episode No. 1 [Air date: 1/5/1995]

daodesc.p: Gay USA, Vol. XIII, Episode No. 1 [Air date: 1/5/1995]: January 1995

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: NOTES: First of 1995.
COMMERCIAL: Kiss, West 10th Street
1. News Notes: Clinton drops gay ambassador James C. Hormel, fearing Jesse Helms reaction. Pataki inaugurated.
COMMERCIAL: Manatus Restaurant
2. Raul Julia's interview with GCN shown again, in which he discusses celebrities coming out of the closet and AIDS.
COMMERCIAL: Poz Magazine
3. AIDS spreading among Native Americans in Canada. David Silver's death announced.
COMMERCIAL: Naya Natural Spring Water
4. Lavender Health: Miguel Arenas interviewed about Cuba. A 60 Minutes piece about detention camps for HIV-positive Cubans excerpted.
COMMERCIAL: The Monster (new commercial with Lou Maletta narration)
5. Protest about lesbian kiss in an NBC TV movie between Judy Davis and Glenn Close. Dear Abby runs gay positive columns. Rosie O'Donnell refered to as a 'closet case'.
COMMERCIAL: Kiss, West 10th Street
6. David Kirby, publisher of Lisp Magazine, is interviewed.
COMMERCIAL: Urad Leather Cream featuring Lou Maletta
7. Gay Games News: Gay Games IV called 'a financial disaster' by several outlets due to its extreme debt. Lee Sharmat sets the record straight.
8. Suzanne Munshower, author of Simply Sophisticated, interviewed.
COMMERCIAL: Absolute Yacht Rental
9. Frank Waters of Hair Farming Care Products is interviewed. Lou Maletta tries out the product on air!
COMMERCIAL: Kiss, West 10th Street

10. GLAAD Media Alert: The Streisand-produced Serving in Silence: The Margarethe Cammermeyer Story is covered. The Family Defense Council is trying to get the program pulled or censored due to its depiction of a lesbian relationship.
COMMERCIAL: Ads Against AIDS

did.unittitle:
Gay USA, Vol. XIII, Episode No. 2
[Air date: 1/12/1995]

dao.xlink:title: Gay USA, Vol. XIII, Episode No. 2 [Air date: 1/12/1995]

daodesc.p: Gay USA, Vol. XIII, Episode No. 2 [Air date: 1/12/1995]: January 1995

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: COMMERCIAL: Kiss, West 10th Street

1. News Notes: Boston St. Patrick's Day Parade case going to Supreme Court. All offices of lesbian and gay concern with government ties no longer exist. Joycelyn Elders may be getting a new job. Cardinal O'Connor retiring. Joe Stefan case covered; stated that he will probably never be able to serve in the military again.
COMMERCIAL: Absolute Yacht Rental
2. Lambda Update: Equal marriage rights for gays and lesbians. Evan Wolfson interviewed.
COMMERCIAL: Manatus Restaurant
3. AIDS News: Gay rights activists hand out condoms and pamphlets to middle schoolers. Several deaths of prominent gays and lesbians announced.
COMMERCIAL: Poz Magazine
4. Lavender Health: Part two of interview with Miguel Arenas.
COMMERCIAL: SAFE, AIDS Council
COMMERCIAL: Lesbian and Gay Public Awareness Project
COMMERCIAL: SF AIDS Foundation
COMMERCIAL: Plaza Florist and Gallery
COMMERCIAL: Kiss, West 10th Street
COMMERCIAL: Naya Natural Spring Water
5. Lee Sharmat describes how a club she was in was busted. Melissa Ethridge says she'd go straight for Brad Pitt.

6. GLAAD Media Alert: Vanity Fair reports via an article called 'The Killing Trial' how anti-gay violence is becoming a kind of 'sport' in Texas for teens. GLAAD has problems with the article for being too sensationalist.
COMMERCIAL: The Monster (with Lou Maletta narration)

7. At Webster Hall, Latinos protest a racist ad the establishment ran in HX Magazine. Frank Guzman, Maritza Martinez, George Ayala, John Wright, Lester Davis interviewed. Disgruntled neighbor Rosemary is interviewed as well.
COMMERCIAL: Urad Leather Cream featuring Lou Maletta
COMMERCIAL: Kiss, West 10th Street

did.unittitle:
Gay USA, Vol. XIII, Episode No. 3
[Air date: 1/19/1995]

dao.xlink:title: Gay USA, Vol. XIII, Episode No. 3 [Air date: 1/19/1995]

daodesc.p: Gay USA, Vol. XIII, Episode No. 3 [Air date: 1/19/1995]: January 1995

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: COMMERCIAL: Kiss, West 10th Street
1. News Notes: West Palm Beach upholds gay rights. India passes law making gay sex punishable by 10 years prison. Gay rights in Canada covered. Doonsberry covered.
COMMERCIAL: Absolute Yacht Rental
2. Cuts at Housing Works. Keith Cylar interviewed.
COMMERCIAL: Manatus Restaurant
3. AIDS News. Gabriel Rotello exposes that the city is failing to close down unsafe sex clubs. Weekly Reader gives Clinton a C- on AIDS.
COMMERCIAL: Poz Magazine
4. GLAAD Media Alert: Sybil on CBS makes tired gay jokes. Viewers are encouraged to write to CBS and tell them to stop making jokes at gay and lesbian expense.
COMMERCIAL: Kiss, West 10th Street
COMMERCIAL: Naya Natural Spring Water
5. Lavender Health: Christobel Jacques is interviewed.
COMMERCIAL: The Monster (with Lou Maletta narration)
6. Hindight with Laurence Frommer: The history of the East Village's gay and lesbian community. The Lesbian Herstory Archives is covered.
COMMERCIAL: Urad Leather Cream featuring Lou Maletta
7. Snowball Fashions. Brigit Pols and Christopher Vance interviewed. Jimmy James performs.
COMMERCIAL: Kiss, West 10th Street
8. More footage from Snowball fashions shown over credits.

did.unittitle:
Gay USA, Vol. XIII, Episode No. 4
[Air date: 1/26/1995]

dao.xlink:title: Gay USA, Vol. XIII, Episode No. 4 [Air date: 1/26/1995]

daodesc.p: Gay USA, Vol. XIII, Episode No. 4 [Air date: 1/26/1995]: January 1995

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: COMMERCIAL: Kiss, West 10th Street

1. News Notes: More on the St. Patrick's Day Parade in Boston. A reverend in South Carolina, performing duties at a funeral for a man who died of AIDS, gives a lengthy speech about whether or not the man would be allowed into heaven. The Pope kicks out a liberal French bishop. OJ Simpson's homophobic remarks covered. Carol Gresser, director of education wants to exclude the culture of gays, minorities, and people with disabilities from being taught about in schools.
COMMERCIAL: Absolute Yacht Rental
2. Tom Duane is interviewed about budget cuts for PWAs. Giulilani has gutted AIDS and disability services. Viewers are encouraged to call the mayor's office.
COMMERCIAL: Manatus Restaurant

3. Entertainment News: Serving in Silence getting benefit via Broadway Cares. Virginia Wolfe would have been 102. Rupaul films guest spot on Sister Sister. Rumors that Jodie Foster is a lesbian. Harvey Milk opera premieres in Huston.
COMMERCIAL: Kiss, West 10th Street
COMMERCIAL: Naya Natural Spring Water
4. Hindsight: Gramercy Park and the legacy of early-20th-century gays and lesbians. Elizabeth Marbury covered.
COMMERCIAL: The Monster (with Lou Maletta narration)
5. The Lambda Update: Beatrice Dorn discusses housing discrimination.
COMMERCIAL: Urad Leather Cream featuring Lou Maletta

6. AIDS News: Puerto Rico has problems with homophobia. Buenos Aires youth resort to spray-painting safe sex messages when their government won't cover condom usage. Board of education approves AIDS education, albeit censored ("The whole curriculum is a piece of shit," says Humm).
COMMERCIAL: Poz Magazine
7. Lavender Health: Cryptosporidium covered with Marci Layton.
COMMERCIAL: Kiss, West 10th Street
8. GLAAD Media Alerts: Metropolis SCU, a DC Comics series, features a lesbian lead character. Viewers are encouraged to write Jennette Kahn at DC Comics.
9. A music video is shown over the credits.

did.unittitle:
Gay USA, Vol. XIII, Episode No. 5
[Air date: 2/2/1995]

dao.xlink:title: Gay USA, Vol. XIII, Episode No. 5 [Air date: 2/2/1995]

daodesc.p: Gay USA, Vol. XIII, Episode No. 5 [Air date: 2/2/1995]: February 1995

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: COMMERCIAL: Kiss, West 10th Street

1. News Notes: Nebraska trying to ban gays from adopting children. DES causing people to be gay? Mary Cummins, who fought the Children of the Rainbow curriculum, says she is resigning because education is going downhill. ACT UP puts a curse on an anti-gay politician. Anti-gay referendums in Iowa.
COMMERCIAL: Absolute Yacht Rental

2. Protest against Dennis Vacco, who has made extremely homophobic comments and is fighting against equal rights legislation. Frances Kunreuther of Hetrick-Martin, Stephen DiBrienza, Franz Leichter, and Annette Robinson speak.
COMMERCIAL: Manatus Restaurant
3. Steven Petronio of the Joyce Dance Theater is interviewed.
COMMERCIAL: Kiss, West 10th Street (Marilyn Monroe)

4. AIDS News: AIDS becomes leading killer of men ages 25-44. 250,000 have died. Non-progressers are covered. 17 arrested in Albany while protesting Patricia Woodworth, who is slashing budgets on behalf of George Pataki. Newt Gingrich blocks legalizing home HIV test kits. AIDS transmission via saliva is 'non existent'.
COMMERCIAL: Naya Natural Spring Water

5. Richard Armey calls Barney Frank a fag, then blasts the press for reporting on it. Barney Frank is then interviewed. Headline News footage. Tom Duane holds a protest against Armey. Chuck Schumer, Alan Hevesi, Mark Green, Matt Foreman, Richard Burns, Ray Dries, Eleanor Cooper,
COMMERCIAL: The Monster (with Lou Maletta narration)

6. Entertainment News: KSFO in San Francisco fires all of its talk show hosts and replaces them with conservatives. Whoopi Goldberg playing a lesbian in Boys on the Side. 24 Hours For Life Gallery promoted. Premiere of Serving in Silence covered. Rosie O'Donnell interviewed briefly. An archival interview with Barbara Streisand shown. A clip from Serving in Silence is shown.
COMMERCIAL: Poz Magazine
7. Lavender Health: Bacterial infections covered, mostly MAC. Beverly Wynne, Moises Agosto, Luis Lopez, Saundra Johnson interviewed.
COMMERCIAL: Urad Leather Cream featuring Lou Maletta
8. GLAAD Media Alert: Coverage in Vanity Fair continues about murders of gays in Texas. ABC Prime Time Live covers the same story. Viewers are encouraged to write to ABC News.
COMMERCIAL: Kiss, West 10th Street (As Time Goes By)
9. Hindsight: Chelsea. The Chelsea Hotel is covered; Sarah Bernhardt, Virgil Thompson, William Burroughs mentioned

did.unittitle: Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 2

dao.xlink:title: Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 2

daodesc.p: Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 2: 1996

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: COMMERCIAL: Lifebeat, "The Music Industry Fights AIDS"
COMMERCIAL: POZ Magazine
1. Lesbian and Gay News: Andy Humm and Lee Sharmat discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community.
COMMERCIAL: Naya, Natural Spring Water

2. Lou Maletta interviews Jean MB Genasci, Vice President of Affiliate Development for PFLAG (Parents, Families, and Friends of Lesbians and Gays), regarding PFLAG's Project Open Mind. Includes two PFLAG advertisement commercials.
3. African American Athletes, Success After Success: Hank Aaron
4. AIDS News
COMMERCIAL: "Panic Disorder: It's real. It's treatable", National Institute of Mental Health
5. Lou Maletta interviews Marya Triandafellos and Patricia Lewis, [Gay Games IV participants], regarding the film "Black and Blue and Gold". Includes film footage.
COMMERCIAL: National Foundation for Infectious Diseases, C. Everett Koop, PSA for Hepatitis A
6. Entertainment News
COMMERCIAL: Urban AID 4 Lifebeat, "The Music Industry Fights AIDS"

7. "Lambda Update": Beatrice Dohrn, Legal Director of Lambda Legal Defense and Education Fund, introduces Lou Maletta's interview with Catherine Hanssens, Lambda AIDS Project Director, regarding policy work and litigation concerning sex clubs.
8. African American Athletes, Success After Success: Nikki Franke
9. Lou Maletta interviews Colin Martin, playwright/actor, regarding his play "Virgins and Other Myths".

did.unittitle: Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 3

dao.xlink:title: Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 3

daodesc.p: Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 3: 1996

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: COMMERCIAL: POZ Magazine
1. Lesbian and Gay News: Andy Humm and Lee Sharmat discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community.
COMMERCIAL: Naya, Natural Spring Water
2. Interview: Dr. Billy Jones and Doug Robinson, former Gay Men's Health Crisis (GMHC) Board Members, discuss their resignation from GMHC.
3. AIDS News
4. Interview: Matt Foreman, Executive Director of the Anti-Violence Project, discusses a recent string of robberies at gay bars.
5. African American Athletes, Success After Success: Willie Davis
6. Entertainment News
7. Lou Maletta interviews Erik Sherman, author, regarding his book "Out at Home: The Glenn Burke Story".
8. Lou Maletta interviews David Rothenberg, [activist and theatre producer], discusses his personal life and his one-man show "At War With the Dinosaurs".
COMMERCIAL: "Panic Disorder: It's real. It's treatable", National Institute of Mental Health
9. Interview: Robert Hilferty, [activist], discusses the course he teaches called "Homosexual Subtext: Hide-and-Seek at the Movies".
10. Lou Maletta interviews Geoff Thompson, regarding his 1996 calendar "If You Want My Body" and the group home he runs.

did.unittitle: Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 4

dao.xlink:title: Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 4

daodesc.p: Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 4: 1996

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: COMMERCIAL: POZ Magazine
1. Lesbian and Gay News: Andy Humm and Lee Sharmat discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community.
COMMERCIAL: Naya, Natural Spring Water
COMMERCIAL: "Panic Disorder: It's real. It's treatable", National Institute of Mental Health
2. Interview: Christopher Lynn, Taxi & Limousine Commissioner, discusses a controversy regarding his pre-suspension of a taxi driver.
3. African American Athletes, Success After Success: Nikki Franke
4. AIDS News
COMMERCIAL: National Foundation for Infectious Diseases, C. Everett Koop, PSA for Hepatitis A
5. Interview: Cheryl Schwartz, author, discusses her book "The Journey Out: A Guide for and About Lesbian, Gay, and Bisexual Teens".
COMMERCIAL: GMHC (Gay Men's Health Crisis), "Fight the Fear"
6. Entertainment News

7. "Lambda Update": Kevin Cathcart, Executive Director of the Lambda Legal Defense and Education Fund, introduces Lou Maletta's interview with Catherine Hanssens, Lambda AIDS Project Director, regarding recent HIV testing proposals.
8. Lou Maletta interviews Lieutenant Grace Telesco and Police Officer Thomas Scaringelli, of the NYPD, regarding recruitment of new NYPD members.
9. Clip of "Coming Out Under Fire" documentary regarding gays in the military.

did.unittitle: Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 5

dao.xlink:title: Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 5

daodesc.p: Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 5: 1996

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: COMMERCIAL: POZ Magazine

1. Lesbian and Gay News: Andy Humm and Lee Sharmat discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community. Includes footage of Ed Koch regarding NYC Mayor Rudy Giuliani's treatment of Ramon Cortines.
COMMERCIAL: Naya, Natural Spring Water

2. Interview: Tom Beer, [filmmaker] with AIDS Community Television, and Kate Barnhart, activist with YELL and ACTUP, discuss Beer's film "Peer Education, Not Fear Education", in which Barnhart appears. Includes film clip.
COMMERCIAL: "Panic Disorder: It's real. It's treatable", National Institute of Mental Health
3. AIDS News
COMMERCIAL: Lesbian and Gay Public Awareness Project, tells the story of Bobby Griffith
4. Footage of Carol Channing at [Champs].
5. African American Athletes, Success After Success: Willie Davis
COMMERCIAL: Elizabeth Taylor for AmFAR, "Don't make it five thousand and one"
6. Clip from Tracey Ullman's show ["Tracey Takes Onâ¦"]. Includes introduction by Andy Humm.
COMMERCIAL: National Foundation for Infectious Diseases, C. Everett Koop, PSA for Hepatitis A
COMMERCIAL: "A Living Memorial to the Holocaust Museum of Jewish Heritage"
7. Footage of Men of Discipline anniversary party at The Lure.
COMMERCIAL: GMHC (Gay Men's Health Crisis), "Fight the Fear"
8. Entertainment News
9. Footage of cast of "Hello, Dolly!" performing "One Night in Heaven".

did.unittitle: Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 6

dao.xlink:title: Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 6

daodesc.p: Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 6: 1996

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: COMMERCIAL: "Party", at the Douglas Fairbanks Theatre

1. Lesbian and Gay News: Andy Humm and Lee Sharmat discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community. Includes Headline News footage regarding a custody case between a lesbian and her convicted murderer husband.
COMMERCIAL: POZ Magazine
2. Interview: Steve Michael, Democratic Presidential Candidate, regarding his campaign.
3. African American Athletes, Success After Success: Hank Aaron
4. Footage of Rich Tafel, Executive Director of the Log Cabin Republicans, at an LCR conference regarding the rating of Republicans in Congress.
5. AIDS News
6. Lou Maletta interviews Phillip Matthews, Acting Executive Director of the People With AIDS (PWA) Coalition, regarding current HIV-related topics and issues.
COMMERCIAL: National Foundation for Infectious Diseases, C. Everett Koop, PSA for Hepatitis A

7. "Lambda Update": Kevin Cathcart, Executive Director of the Lambda Legal Defense and Education Fund, introduces Lou Maletta's interview with Suzanne Goldberg, Lambda Staff Attorney, regarding a Russian lesbian named Alla Pitcherskaia who is seeking political asylum in the US.
8. Entertainment News. Includes footage of Alice Walker on "Charlie Walker".
9. Footage of "All My Children".
COMMERCIAL: Lesbian and Gay Public Awareness Project, tells the story of Bobby Griffith
10. Andy Humm promotes "Virgins and Other Myths", a one-man play by Colin Martin.
COMMERCIAL: "Party", at the Douglas Fairbanks Theatre
11. African American Athletes, Success After Success: Nikki Franke
COMMERCIAL: "Panic Disorder: It's real. It's treatable", National Institute of Mental Health

did.unittitle: Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 7

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Program Content: Unknown

dao.xlink:title: Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 8

daodesc.p: Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 8: 1996

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: COMMERCIAL: AIDS Research Associates
COMMERCIAL: Homo Xtra, "The one. The only. The original."

1. Lesbian and Gay News: Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community. Includes NBC footage of Pat Buchanan, Republican Presidential Candidate, speaking in Manchester.
COMMERCIAL: "Party", at the Douglas Fairbanks Theatre
2. Footage from CSPAN of discussion regarding same-sex marriage, hosted by the Los Angeles Freedom to Marry Coalition. Includes footage of Evan Wolfson, of Lambda Legal Defense and Education Fund.
COMMERCIAL: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), "America Responds to AIDS"
3. AIDS News
COMMERCIAL: National AIDS Hotline

4. David Nimmons, Managing Director of Education at Gay Men's Health Crisis (GMHC), and Carlos Cordero, from the [Community AIDS Prevention Activists], discuss CrossTalk, to be held at the Lesbian and Gay Community Services Center.
COMMERCIAL: Ad Council, Earth Share, "It's a connected world."

5. Beatrice Dohrn, Legal Director of Lambda Legal Defense and Education Fund, introduces Lou Maletta's interview with David Buckel, Lambda Staff Attorney, regarding violence against lesbian and gay youth in schools.
COMMERCIAL: Ad Council, "It's what in the world you can do".
6. Ralph Garcia, licensed physical therapist and doctoral candidate at NYU, discusses and requests volunteers for his research regarding stroke survivors.
7. Entertainment News
COMMERCIAL: POZ Magazine
COMMERCIAL: "Party", at the Douglas Fairbanks Theatre
8. Footage of Community Health Project's "Snowball" event. Includes footage of Lee Sharmat interviewing Kim Barget, chair of "Snowball".
COMMERCIAL: AIDS Research Associates
COMMERCIAL: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), "America Responds to AIDS"
9. Footage of [hypersexualized people and artwork].

did.unittitle: Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 9

dao.xlink:title: Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 9

daodesc.p: Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 9: 1996

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: COMMERCIAL: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), "America Responds to AIDS"
COMMERCIAL: POZ Magazine
COMMERCIAL: AIDS Research Associates

1. Lesbian and Gay News: Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community. Includes CSPAN footage of Kenneth Bacon at Pentagon News Briefing regarding issues with "Don't Ask/Don't Tell". Also includes NY1 footage of Norman Siegel, Executive Director of NYCLU (New York Civil Liberties Union), and Rudy Giuliani, NYC Mayor, regarding zoning laws that affect adult-themed businesses.
2. Footage of Bishop Walter Righter on Nightline discussing the ordaining of openly gay men.
COMMERCIAL: Ad Council, National Alliance for Research on Schizophrenia and Depression
3. Interview: Ann Maguire and Sal Cecere, of the Irish Lesbian and Gay Organization, discuss the upcoming St. Patrick's Day parade.
4. AIDS News
COMMERCIAL: "Party", at the Douglas Fairbanks Theatre
5. Lou Maletta interviews Robert Kobel, of the Internal Revenue Service (IRS), regarding tax issues that affect the gay community.
COMMERCIAL: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), "America Responds to AIDS"
6. Entertainment News
COMMERCIAL: Homo Xtra, "The one. The only. The original."

7. Footage of the Gay and Lesbian Community Services Center's 4th annual Music and Comedy Gala. Includes footage of Karen Williams, [comic]; the Flirtations, [a capella group]; Tret Fure and Cris Williamson, [musicians]; and Nell Carter [singer/actress].
COMMERCIAL: AIDS Research Associates
8. Lou Maletta interviews Doris Kloster, photographer, regarding her self-titled photobook.
COMMERCIAL: "Party", at the Douglas Fairbanks Theatre
COMMERCIAL: "Support Human Rights for Lesbian and Gay People", sponsored by Professionals in Film/Video. Includes Cathay Che of GLAAD.

did.unittitle: Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 10

dao.xlink:title: Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 10

daodesc.p: Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 10: 1996

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: COMMERCIAL: Homo Xtra, "The one. The only. The original."
COMMERCIAL: Dan Gendron, Horologist, "Stop paying too much for antique watches"
COMMERCIAL: AIDS Research Associates

1. Lesbian and Gay News: Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community. Includes clip of Andy Humm questioning Bob Dole, Republican Presidential Candidate. Also includes clip of young Bob Dole in POW camp during WWII. Also includes clip of Steve Forbes, Republican Presidential Candidate, on 60 Minutes. Also includes footage of Andy Humm interviewing Tom Duane, NYC Council Member, during protest of Republican bigotry. Also includes interviews with Charles Gargano, [Vice Chairman of the Port Authority of NY]; Mark Green, [NYC Public Advocate]; and Fred Hochberg and Mark Aurigemma.
COMMERCIAL: POZ Magazine
2. AIDS News. Includes footage of CNN [special] regarding how and possibly why AIDS affects different groups of people internationally.
COMMERCIAL: Ad Council, National Alliance for Research on Schizophrenia and Depression
3. Andy Humm interviews Chris Bauer and Doug Robinson, Candidates for NYC School Board, regarding their platforms.
COMMERCIAL: Ad Council, Earth Share, "It's a connected world."
4. Ralph Garcia, licensed physical therapist and doctoral candidate at NYU, discusses and requests volunteers for his research regarding stroke survivors.
5. Entertainment News
COMMERCIAL: Homo Xtra, "The one. The only. The original."

6. Footage of Gary Miller, Director, and Ann Hampton Callaway, singer, with the NYC Gay Men's Chorus. Includes interviews with Miller and Callaway regarding the current program "With a Song in Our Heart" of Rodgers and Hart music.
7. Lou Maletta promotes Andrew Barrett and Chris Burney's Pop Diva Taylor Dane in "Archy and Mehitabel".
8. Lou Maletta interviews Dirk Shafer, Playgirl's "Man of the Year", regarding his personal life. Includes clip of Shafer's film "Man of the Year".
COMMERCIAL: AIDS Research Associates
COMMERCIAL: Dan Gendron, Horologist, "Stop paying too much for antique watches"

9. "Lambda Update": Kevin Cathcart, Executive Director of the Lambda Legal Defense and Education Fund, introduces Lou Maletta's interview with Suzanne Goldberg, Lambda Staff Attorney, regarding a recent victory in Portland, Oregon, on behalf of ACTUP protestors who had been illegally strip searched after being arrested at a demonstration.
COMMERCIAL: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), "America Responds to AIDS"

10. Footage of NYC Council General Welfare Committee from March 1986 discussing lesbian and gay rights bill. Includes footage of Tom Stoddard, co-author, Intro. 2; Andy Humm, gay activist; Joyce Hunger, of the NYC Human Rights Commission; and Patrick Silva, Attorney.

scopecontent.p: COMMERCIAL: POZ Magazine
COMMERCIAL: AIDS Research Associates
1. Lesbian and Gay News: Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community.
COMMERCIAL: Homo Xtra, "The one. The only. The original."
COMMERCIAL: abOUT Entertainment
COMMERCIAL: Dan Gendron, Horologist, "Stop paying too much for antique watches"
2. Footage of GLAAD Media Awards. Includes footage of Robert Wooley, auctioneer; Raquel Welch, actress; Barbara Walters, journalist; and Ru Paul, drag queen.
3. Footage of 1996 St. Patrick's Day parade and protests by Irish Lesbian and Gay Organization.
COMMERCIAL: Imperial Court, Night of 1000 Gowns
4. Lou Maletta interviews Robert Kobel, of the Internal Revenue Service (IRS), regarding tax issues that affect the gay community.
COMMERCIAL: AIDS Walk New York
COMMERCIAL: Ad Council, Earth Share, "It's a connected world."
5. AIDS News
6. Entertainment News. Includes footage of JFK, Jr. quarreling in Washington Square Park with a lady friend.
COMMERCIAL: AIDS Research Associates
7. Lou Maletta interviews Jeffrey Friedman, Co-Producer and Co-Director of "The Celluloid Closet", discusses the film. Includes film clips.
COMMERCIAL: Dan Gendron, Horologist, "Stop paying too much for antique watches"
8. Interview: Anthony Heilbut, author, discusses his book "Thomas Mann: Eros and Literature".
9. Lou Maletta interviews Joseph Cohen, author, regarding his book "You Know You're Gay Whenâ¦".

dao.xlink:title: Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 12

daodesc.p: Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 12: 1996

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: COMMERCIAL: POZ Magazine
COMMERCIAL: AIDS Research Associates

1. Lesbian and Gay News: Andy Humm discusses recent general events that relate to the LGBT community. Includes footage of Andy Humm and Lee Sharmat at St. Patrick's Day parade, which includes footage of Tom Duane, NYC Council Member; Anne Maguire, of the Irish Lesbian and Gay Organization (ILGO); William Donahue, of the Catholic League for Religious and Civil Rights; Ed Sullivan, of the NYS Assembly; Gifford Miller, of the NYC Council; Louis Anemone, Chief of Department, NYPD; Cardinal John Joseph O'Connor, "Archbigot" of NY; Matt Foreman, of the Gay and Lesbian Anti-Violence Project; Rudy Giuliani, NYC Mayor; William Bratton, NYC Police Commissioner; Ed Koch, former NYC Mayor; Al D'Amato, US Senator; Gerry Adams, of Sinn Fein; and Stanley Michels, NYC Council Member.
COMMERCIAL: Homo Xtra, "The one. The only. The original."
COMMERCIAL: abOUT Entertainment
COMMERCIAL: Dan Gendron, Horologist, "Stop paying too much for antique watches"

2. Footage from NY1 of Governor George Pataki responding to call-in question from Andy Humm. Also includes footage of Andy Humm directly questioning Pataki, NYC Mayor Rudy Giuliani, and US Senator Al D'Amato [during St. Patrick's Day parade].
COMMERCIAL: Imperial Court, Night of 1000 Gowns
3. AIDS News
4. Clip of GLSTN [Gay, Lesbian, and Straight Teachers Network] video "Setting the Record Straight" regarding gays and lesbians in schools.
COMMERCIAL: Ad Council, Earth Share, "It's a connected world."

5. Lambda Update": Kevin Cathcart, Executive Director of the Lambda Legal Defense and Education Fund, introduces Lou Maletta's interview with Kim Kirkley, Lambda Staff Attorney, regarding the National Black Gay and Lesbian Leadership Forum's recent annual conference in Dallas, Texas.
COMMERCIAL: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), "America Responds to AIDS"
6. Entertainment News
7. Footage of Lou Maletta interviewing Delmas Howe, artist, at the Leslie-Lohman Gay Art Foundation regarding his exhibition "My Jesus Lives in Albuquerque".
8. Ralph Garcia, licensed physical therapist and doctoral candidate at NYU, discusses and requests volunteers for his research regarding stroke survivors.
COMMERCIAL: Dan Gendron, Horologist, "Stop paying too much for antique watches"
9. Lou Maletta interviews John Laub, artist, [at the Fischbach Gallery] regarding his artwork and personal life.

did.unittitle: Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 13

dao.xlink:title: Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 13

daodesc.p: Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 13: 1996

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: COMMERCIAL: POZ Magazine
COMMERCIAL: Homo Xtra, "The one. The only. The original."
1. Lesbian and Gay News: Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community.
COMMERCIAL: AIDS Walk New York
2. AIDS News. Includes NY1 footage of youth AIDS activists at Board of Education regarding sex education.
3. Ralph Garcia, licensed physical therapist and doctoral candidate at NYU, discusses and requests volunteers for his research regarding stroke survivors.
COMMERCIAL: Dan Gendron, Horologist, "Stop paying too much for antique watches"

4. Footage of Lee Sharmat at Empire State Pride Agenda's Night of 100 Parties. Includes interviews with Laurie Dietz, [activist]; Mark Levine, [activist]; Mark Tadlock, [activist]; and Dick Dadey, Executive Director of the Empire State Pride Agenda.
COMMERCIAL: Imperial Court, Night of 1000 Gowns
COMMERCIAL: Ad Council, Earth Share, "It's a connected world."
5. Entertainment News. Includes clip of Kevin Spacey at Academy Awards. Also includes NBC footage regarding Luciano Pavarotti's sex symbol status.
COMMERCIAL: Ad Council, National Alliance for Research on Schizophrenia and Depression
COMMERCIAL: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), "America Responds to AIDS"
6. Footage of Perry Watkins, [gay military service member], speaking at the 1988 National Democratic Convention.
COMMERCIAL: abOUT Entertainment
COMMERCIAL: Dan Gendron, Horologist, "Stop paying too much for antique watches"
7. Lou Maletta interviews Peter H. Duesberg, author, regarding his book "Inventing the AIDS Virus", in which he denies HIV is the cause of AIDS.
COMMERCIAL: Homo Xtra, "The one. The only. The original."
COMMERCIAL: Static
8. Lou Maletta interviews Dan Kisner, President and Chief Operating Officer for Isis Pharmaceuticals, regarding a new drug called ISIS 2922 to combat the Cytomegalovirus (CMV) in AIDS patients.
COMMERCIAL: AIDS Research Associates
COMMERCIAL: "Support Human Rights for Lesbian and Gay People", sponsored by Professionals in Film/Video. Includes Cathay Che of GLAAD.
9. Clip of "The Ambiguously Gay Duo" sketch from The Dana Carvey Show.

did.unittitle: Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 14

daodesc.p: Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 14: 1996

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: COMMERCIAL: abOUT Entertainment
COMMERCIAL: POZ Magazine

1. Lesbian and Gay News: Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community. Includes footage of the Gay Officers Action League (GOAL) announcing first ever lawsuit against police department for discrimination, which includes footage of Fran DeBenedictis, of GOAL; Edgar Rodriguez, [of GOAL]; Tom Duane, NYC Council Member; and Matt Foreman, of the Anti-Violence Project.
COMMERCIAL: AIDS Walk New York
COMMERCIAL: Ad Council, Earth Share, "It's a connected world."
2. AIDS News
3. Ralph Garcia, licensed physical therapist and doctoral candidate at NYU, discusses and requests volunteers for his research regarding stroke survivors.
COMMERCIAL: Dan Gendron, Horologist, "Stop paying too much for antique watches"

4. Footage of Lee Sharmat at the Tenth Anniversary of NYC's Lesbian and Gay Rights Bill. Includes footage of Allen Roskoff, activist/recipient of Harold Pickett Award; Eleanor Cooper, [activist]; Andy Humm, gay activist and journalist; Steve Ziffer, [activist]/recipient of Harold Pickett Award; Joyce Hunter, [activist]/recipient of Harold Pickett Award; Arnie Kantrowitz, activist; and Janice Tomm, Co-Coordinator of Heritage of Pride '96.
COMMERCIAL: Imperial Court, Night of 1000 Gowns
COMMERCIAL: Homo Xtra, "The one. The only. The original."

daodesc.p: Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 31: 1996

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: 1. Footage of GCN correspondents Ann Northrop and Ed Anderson at the 1996 Republican National Convention. Includes footage of L. Brent Bozell, conservative columnist; Barbara Bateman, Ohio Delegate; Mary Fisher, PWA (People With AIDS) Speaker; and Strom Thurmond, Senator from South Carolina.
COMMERCIAL: 1-800-372-AIDS, research study. [Narrated by Peter Thomas]
COMMERCIAL: Confide, HIV Testing Service

2. Additional footage of GCN correspondents Ann Northrop and Ed Anderson at the 1996 Republican National Convention. Includes interviews with Arianna Huffington, [commentator]; Gary Bauer, of the Family Research Council; Dick Armey, Representative from Texas, House Majority Leader; and George Pataki, Governor of NY.
COMMERCIAL: POZ Magazine
3. Additional footage of GCN correspondents Ann Northrop and Ed Anderson at the 1996 Republican National Convention. Includes interview with Jim McCrery, Representative from Louisiana.
COMMERCIAL: 12 Gods Party
COMMERCIAL: 1-800-372-AIDS, research study. [Narrated by Peter Thomas]

4. Footage of Ann Northrop outside the 1996 Republican National Convention, where advocacy groups were protesting. Includes footage of Melinda Paras, Executive Director of the National Gay and Lesbian Task Force (NGLTF), and Eric Rofes, gay activist.
COMMERCIAL: Confide, HIV Testing Service

5. Footage of GCN correspondents Ed Anderson and Ann Northrop outside the 1996 Republican National Convention, where advocacy groups were protesting. Includes footage of Nicole Ramirez Murray, gay activist; Derek Hodel, of GMHC (Gay Men's Health Crisis), "Condom Man"; David Smith, of the Human Rights Campaign (HRC); Melinda Paras, Executive Director of the National Gay and Lesbian Task Force (NGLTF); Candace Gingrich, of the Human Rights Campaign (HRC); Ralph Reed of the Christian Coalition; and Al Franken, of Comedy Central.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: 1. Footage of GCN correspondents Ann Northrop and Ed Anderson at the 1996 Republican National Convention. Includes footage of Rich Tafel, of the Log Cabin Republicans, and John McLaughlin, TV host.

2. Additional footage of GCN correspondents Ed Anderson and Ann Northrop of the 1996 Republican National Convention. Includes footage of Rev. Lou Sheldon, of the Traditional Values Coalition, and Melinda Paras, of the National Gay and Lesbian Task Force (NGLTF).
COMMERCIAL: AIDS Walk Long Island

3. Additional footage of GCN correspondents Ed Anderson and Ann Northrop of the 1996 Republican National Convention. Includes footage of Steve Forbes, [former candidate in the 1996 Republican presidential primary]; Phyllis Schlafly, of Eagle Forum; and [unnamed] Buchanan alternate.
COMMERCIAL: Confide, HIV Testing Service

4. Additional footage of GCN correspondents Ed Anderson and Ann Northrop of the 1996 Republican National Convention. Includes footage of Rick Santorum, Senator from Pennsylvania; Betsy McCaughey Ross, Lieutenant Governor of NY; and Jim Kolbe, Representative from Arizona.
COMMERCIAL: Homo Xtra, "The one. The only. The original."

5. Additional footage of GCN correspondents Ed Anderson and Ann Northrop of the 1996 Republican National Convention. Includes footage of Colonel Oliver North; Dan Quayle, former Vice President; Mark Foley, Representative from Florida; Alan Simpson, Senator from Wyoming; and Michelangelo Signorile.

Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 33

dao.xlink:title: Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 33

daodesc.p: Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 33: 1996

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: 1. Footage of GCN correspondents Ann Northrop and Ed Anderson at the 1996 Democratic National Convention. Includes footage of Elizabeth Birch, Executive Director of the Human Rights Campaign (HRC); Paul Simon, Democratic Senator from Illinois; Frank Lautenberg, Democratic Senator from New Jersey; Ron Wyden, Democratic Senator from Oregon; Daniel Moynihan, Democratic Senator from New York; Jay Rockefeller; Democratic Senator from West Virginia; Byron Dorgan, Democratic Senator from North Dakota; Charles Robb, Democratic Senator from Virginia; Bill Bradley, Democratic Senator from New Jersey; Carl Levin, Democratic Senator from Michigan; Tom Harkin, Democratic Senator from Iowa; and Howell Heflin, Democratic Senator from Alabama.
COMMERCIAL: POZ Magazine

2. Additional footage of GCN correspondents Ann Northrop and Ed Anderson at the 1996 Democratic National Convention. Includes footage of Eleanor Homes Norton, Representative from Washington, DC; John Kerry, Democratic Senator from Massachusetts; Barbara Boxer, Democratic Senator from California; Chris Dodd, Democratic Senator from Connecticut, Chair of the Democratic National Committee; and Patrick Leahy, Democratic Senator from Vermont.
COMMERCIAL: Homo Xtra, "The one. The only. The original."
COMMERCIAL: AIDS Walk Long Island
3. Footage of Ann Northrop interviewing Phill Wilson, of AIDS Project Los Angeles, at the Democratic National Convention.

4. Footage of ACTUP demonstration at Democratic National Convention. Includes footage of Richard Liu, gay delegate from Pennsylvania; Marti Schrank, of Fullerton, CA; Steve Michael, of Washington, DC, presidential candidate from the AIDS Cure Party; and "The Al Gore 7", which includes Wayne Turner.
COMMERCIAL: Static
COMMERCIAL: Ad Council, International Association of Clerks, Recorders, Election Officials, & Treasurers, "Vote for Yourself"
5. Lou Maletta interviews Candace Gingrich, author, regarding her book "The Accidental Activist".
COMMERCIAL: Homo Xtra, "The one. The only. The original."

6. "Lambda Update": William Peters, Development Director of Lambda Legal Defense and Education Fund, introduces Lou Maletta's interview with Patricia Logue, Lambda Managing Attorney for the Midwest Region, regarding Cincinnati Issue 3 case.
7. Additional footage of GCN correspondents Ann Northrop and Ed Anderson at the 1996 Democratic National Convention. Includes footage of Maxine Waters, Democratic Representative from California.

scopecontent.p: 1. Lesbian and Gay News: Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community. Includes footage of Rudolph Giuliani, NYC Mayor, meeting lesbian and gay journalists.

2. AIDS News
COMMERCIAL: Visit the AIDS Memorial Quilt

4. Footage from Court TV of the "trial of 3 same-sex couples suing the state of Hawaii for right to get married", Baerh v. Miike. Includes cross-examination of Kyle Pruett, MD, child psychiatrist, by Evan Wolfson, of Lambda Legal Defense and Education Fund. Also includes Rick Eichor, Deputy Attorney General of Hawaii, and Dan Foley, Plaintiff's Co-Counsel, giving closing arguments.
5. Footage of the Mr. International Drummer contest 1996. Includes Jerry Leigh, 2nd runner-up; Ken Rosetti, 1st runner-up; and Kyle Brandon, winner.

daodesc.p: Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 39: 1996

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: 1. Lesbian and Gay News: Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community. Includes footage of Ann Northrop and [Michelangelo Signorile] at event for Barbara Mikulski, Senator, regarding her support of the Defense of Marriage Act (DOMA). Also includes CNN coverage of trial of Jonathan Schmitz, who murdered a gay acquaintance named Scott Amedure, who had revealed his crush on Schmitz during an episode of 'The Jenny Jones Show".
COMMERCIAL: Ad Council, Crime Prevention Coalition and US Department of Justice
2. AIDS News. Includes footage from Diva TV/ACTUP NY of AIDS Quilt event in Washington, DC.
COMMERCIAL: American Chiropractic Association, "Vote"

3. Footage from CSPAN of gay and lesbian vote rally in Washington, DC. Includes footage of Muffin Spencer-Devlin, professional golfer; Chastity Bono, of the Human Rights Campaign; and Cher, singer/mother of Chastity Bono.
4. Footage from CSPAN of Michael Johnston, Chairman of National Coming Out of Homosexuality Day, regarding his group.
COMMERCIAL: GMHC (Gay Men's health Crisis), "Help us help."

5. "Lambda Update": Beatrice Dohrn, Legal Director of Lambda Legal Defense and Education Fund, introduces Lou Maletta's interview with Catherine Hanssens, Lambda AIDS Project Director, regarding government compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act.
6. Footage of town meeting on same-sex marriage. Includes footage of Rev. Pat Bumgardner, of MCCNY (Metropolitan Community Church of NY), and Ann Northrop.
7. Entertainment News. Includes clip of the film "Braveheart".

Gay USA, Vol. XV, Episode No. 1

dao.xlink:title: Gay USA, Vol. XV, Episode No. 1

daodesc.p: Gay USA, Vol. XV, Episode No. 1: 1997

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: "Gay Year in Review â 1996" (Clips from this episode are pulled from previous episodes from 1996; some have been slightly edited.)

1. Footage of Andy Humm and Lee Sharmat at St. Patrick's Day parade, which includes footage of Tom Duane, NYC Council Member; William Donahue, of the Catholic League for Religious and Civil Rights; Ed Sullivan, of the NYS Assembly; Louis Anemone, Chief of Department, NYPD; Cardinal John Joseph O'Connor, "Archbigot" of NY; Rudy Giuliani, NYC Mayor; William Bratton, NYC Police Commissioner; Ed Koch, former NYC Mayor; and Al D'Amato, US Senator.
2. Footage of GLAAD Media Awards. Includes footage of Robert Wooley, auctioneer; Raquel Welch, actress; Barbara Walters, journalist; and Ru Paul, drag queen.
3. Footage of Lee Sharmat at Night of 1000 Gowns.
COMMERCIAL: Static
COMMERCIAL: Condomania, "Dress the part"

4. Footage of GCN correspondents Ann Northrop and Ed Anderson at the 1996 Democratic National Convention. Includes footage of Paul Simon, Democratic Senator from Illinois; Frank Lautenberg, Democratic Senator from New Jersey; Ron Wyden, Democratic Senator from Oregon; Daniel Moynihan, Democratic Senator from New York; Jay Rockefeller; Democratic Senator from West Virginia; Byron Dorgan, Democratic Senator from North Dakota; Charles Robb, Democratic Senator from Virginia; Bill Bradley, Democratic Senator from New Jersey; Carl Levin, Democratic Senator from Michigan; and Howell Heflin, Democratic Senator from Alabama.
COMMERCIAL: Homo Xtra, "The one. The only. The original."
COMMERCIAL: Condomania, "Induce penis envy"

5. Andy Humm discusses the Colorado Amendment 2 court decision. Includes interviews with Suzanne Goldberg, Staff Attorney for Lambda Legal Defense and Education Fund; Tom Stoddard, veteran gay activist; and Deborah Glick, of the NYS Assembly.

6. Andy Humm discusses the Hawaii same-sex marriage case. Includes interviews with Evan Wolfson, [Staff Attorney for] Lambda Legal Defense and Education Fund, and Co-Counsel in the Hawaii same-sex marriage case; Jerry Nadler, of the US Congress; and members of the general public. Also includes footage of Rudy Giuliani, NYC Mayor; Tom DeLay, Representative from Texas/Republican Whip; Sam Gejdenson, Democratic Representative from Connecticut; Gerry Studds, Democratic Representative from Massachusetts; Steve Gunderson, Republican Representative from Wisconsin; Barney Frank; Democrat with the Subcommittee on the Constitution of the Judiciary Committee; and Henry Hyde, Republican Representative from Illinois/Judiciary Committee Chairman.
COMMERCIAL: Homo Xtra, "The one. The only. The original."
COMMERCIAL: Condomania, "Make it part of your routine"

7. Footage of "The Great Wed-In" at Bryant Park. Includes footage of Tom Duane, NYC Council Member; Gloria Steinem, activist; William Wynkoop and Roy Strickland; Connie and Dorothy Danaher; and Tori Watson and Scott Blankenship.
8. Footage of 1996 Gay and Lesbian Pride March.
9. Footage of Dyke March. Includes Lee Sharmat interviewing Kim Barget.
10. Clip of "The Ambiguously Gay Duo" sketch from The Dana Carvey Show.

COMMERCIAL: SAGE (Senior Action in a Gay Environment)
2. Jesus Lebron and Gary Lawman, of Gay and Lesbian Advocates for Change, promote a rally in support of Ruth Messinger for NYC Mayor.
COMMERCIAL: Cable Positive, "AIDS is not over"

3. "Lambda Update": Kevin Cathcart, Executive Director of the Lambda Legal Defense and Education Fund, introduces Jennifer Pizer, Western Regional Office Managing Attorney, and Jane Morrison, Southern Regional Office Managing Attorney, who discuss Lambda's domestic partnership work nationwide.
4. AIDS News
COMMERCIAL: National AIDS Hotline
5. Interview: Robert D. Zimmerman, author, discusses his book "Hostage".
COMMERCIAL: CDC National AIDS Hotline, PSA for providing food for homebound people with AIDS
6. "Here's to Our Health: Lesbian and Gay Health Concerns": Timm Sharbaugh discusses AIDS statistics and news.
7. Entertainment
8. Promo for PBS show "In the Life"
9. Per Larson, author of "Gay Money", discusses what happens financially when people are in their 30s.
10. Clip from upcoming HBO "Intimate Portrait" episode featuring Dr. Susan Love, a lesbian breast cancer specialist and adoptive mother.

2. Interview: Paula Ettelbrick, Legislative Director of the Empire State Pride Agenda, discusses ESPA's decision to remain neutral in the NYC Mayoral race between Ruth Messinger and Rudolph Giuliani.
COMMERCIAL: CDC National AIDS Hotline, PSA for providing food for homebound people with AIDS
3. Jesus Lebron and Gary Lawman, of Gay and Lesbian Advocates for Change, promote multiple rallies in support of Ruth Messinger for NYC Mayor.
4. AIDS News
COMMERCIAL: Elizabeth Taylor for AmFAR, "Don't make it five thousand and one"
5. "Here's to Our Health: Lesbian and Gay Health Concerns": Timm Sharbaugh discusses the bacteria campylobacter, which can cause bowel problems.
6. Entertainment

COMMERCIAL: CDC National Aids Hotline, "When I Grow Up"
8. Footage of contest at The Eagle, in celebration of their 27th anniversary.

4. Interview: Dot Staruch and Richard Rogers, of the dance committee of Senior Action in a Gay Environment (SAGE), discuss upcoming LGBT dances.
5. Entertainment
6. Clip from "Will and Grace" season opener.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: 1. Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community.
2. Footage of Bill Clinton at the Empire State Pride Agenda dinner discussing political issues affecting the LGBT community.
3. Footage of Andy Humm interviewing attendees at the Empire State Pride Agenda dinner.
4. Lesbian and Gay News
5. Interview: Howie Katz, Director of the New York regional office of the Anti-Defamation League, discusses hate crimes legislation.
6. AIDS News

8. Entertainment

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: 1. Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community.

3. Footage from C-SPAN of Judy Shepard, mother of Matthew Shepard, at the Human Rights Campaign Annual Dinner. Includes Human Rights Campaign commercial featuring Judy Shepard.

5. AIDS News
6. Entertainment

8. Footage from Matthew Shepard political funeral.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content

3. Interview: Grant Lukenbill, author and consultant, discusses Exxon's cancellation of domestic partner benefits.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: 1. Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community.

2. Interview: Emmaia Gelman, of the Irish Lesbian and Gay Organization (ILGO), and Brendan Fay, [Founder] of the Lavender and Green Alliance, discuss their groups' previous and upcoming efforts and events.
COMMERCIAL: 7th International Gay and Lesbian 2000 Business and Entertainment Festival

COMMERCIAL: 7th International Gay and Lesbian 2000 Business and Entertainment Festival
5. Entertainment
6. Clip from Monika Treut's film "Gendernauts".

7. Lou Maletta discusses his upcoming presentation at the Community Center regarding the history and importance of gay cable. Maletta also mentions that they have 6000 videos in their archive which will be digitized and eventually put on the Internet for people to see.

daodesc.p: [1]--Pride and Progress. Episode No. 1 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 118 [Air Date: 10/4/1984]: October 1984

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News - highlights:
1. Massachusetts Congressman Gary Studds, openly gay, wins primary victory; Interview with David Bender of the Studds campaign
COMMERCIAL: "Badlands," NYC gay bar
2. Sports report
3. Federal government requests AIDS funding
4. Rutgers University offers "Homosexuality in Society" course
5. FBI files on gay organizations released
6. Referendum to repeal gay rights in Maryland
7. Human Rights Commission: gay and lesbian discrimination documentation project; interview with Katy Taylor
COMMERCIAL: Chamberlain and Associates, career service professionals
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native"
8. Three teens charged in death of Charles Howard, a gay man in Maine
9. Interview with Vivian Shapiro, Human Rights Campaign
COMMERCIAL: "The Connect"
Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Dr. Steven Caiazza discusses "How to Reduce Risk of Getting AIDS"
COMMERCIAL: World of Video
The Right Stuff:
COMMERCIAL: National Fund for Human Dignity with Abigail "Dear Abby" Van Buren
COMMERCIAL: Pensione, San Francisco Hotel
1. Interview with Phyllis Diller, entertainer
COMMERCIAL: H. Clay Friedrichs Realtors, New Jersey
COMMERCIAL: Rio Adventure, Orpheo travel agency
2."Brothers," a Showtime cable comedy series
COMMERCIAL: "People in Touch," a gay dating service
3. "Fever of an Unknown Origin" - Interviews with actor playwright Stephen Holt, actor Raymie Priesmeyer, scenes from the play
COMMERCIAL: World of Video
COMMERCIAL: Spur Productions
4. Phyllis Diller interview/ closing credits
COMMERCIAL National Fund for Human Dignity with Judge Steven Lax

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News - highlights:
1. Sentencing of Maine teens in death of Charles Howard, a gay man
2. San Francisco rejects extending employment benefits to gay partners of city workers
3. First Ronald Reagan versus Walter Mondale debate viewed by gay Mondale supporters
COMMERCIAL: "Badlands," NYC gay bar
4. Sports Report
5. Interview with Ivan [Deeds] about Gay Narcotics Anonymous
6. Sweden as a place for political asylum for gays
7. Sentencing of Gary Lee Hopper, a male hustler, in slashing and attempted robbery of gay man
8. Gay center opens in Allentown, Pennsylvania
9. Interview with Peter Vogel, Chairperson for New York Gay Task Force
COMMERCIAL: Rio Adventure, Orpheo travel agency
COMMERCIAL: Chamberlain and Associates, career service professionals
10. Interview with Peter Guardino, Gay Police Officers Action League
11. Proposal to make West Hollywood a city
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native"
Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Dr. Scott Croxson, Fellow Immunopathology, discusses HTLV virus
COMMERCIAL: "The Connection," a gay newspaper
The Right Stuff:
COMMERCIAL: National Fund for Human Dignity with actor Mike Farrell
1. Footage from San Francisco memorial for John Simms, who passed away from AIDS
COMMERCIAL: H. Clay Friedrichs Realtors, New Jersey
COMMERCIAL: Rio Adventure, Orpheo travel agency
2.Interview with director Robert Epstein, producer Richard Schmiechen, and publicist Vito Russo, "The Times of Harvey Milk"
COMMERCIAL: Pensione, San Francisco Hotel
COMMERCIAL: Spur Productions
3. "Swan in Love," commentary and clips about motion picture
COMMERCIAL National Fund for Human Dignity with actor Jack Albertson
COMMERCIAL: World of Video
4. More from interviews about "The Times of Harvey Milk"/ closing credits

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News - highlights:
1. New York Executive Order #50 - a non-discrimination policy on city contactors
2. Interview with Willy Smith, Gay and Lesbian Inter-Religious Coalition
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native," with Quentin Crisp
3. Interview with Nancy Roth, executive director of Gay Rights National Lobby, Washington D.C.
COMMERCIAL: Chamberlain and Associates, Career Service Professionals
4. AIDS fears in court
5. Interview with Tim Sweeney, director of LAMBDA Legal Defense, discussing LAMBDA's AIDS Legal Guide
COMMERCIAL: "Rome Adventure," Orpheo Travel Agency
6. Interview with Reverend Karen Zeigler, director of Metropolitan Community Church, discussing their on-going application to the National Council of Churches
COMMERCIAL: "The Times of Harvey Milk"
7. Gay and lesbian child custody announcement
8. LAMBDA Democrats, authors night
COMMERCIAL: Arcos Blancos Resort, San Juan, Puerto Rico
9. Heathline: Conversations with GMHC: Dr. Jeffrey Lawrence, NY Hospital, Cornell Medical Center, discusses new directions in treating AIDS
COMMERCIAL: "Badlands," NYC gay bar
10. Sports Report: Interview with Jim Link and Leslie Randolph, Rambler Soccer Club
The Right Stuff:
1. 1984 Halloween on Christopher Street, NYC
COMMERCIAL: "The Connection," gay/lesbian newspaper
2. Lo Nardo, music group, performing
COMMERCIAL: "The Times of Harvey Milk"
3. Broadway star Vivian Blaine performing "live" at SAGE Benefit at the Limelight, NYC. Songs: "Guys and Dolls medley"
COMMERCIAL: National Fund for Human Dignity with Abigail "Dear Abby" Van Buren
4. Media Report: "Hollywood Babylon II," Japanese condoms, Cardinal Spellman, Michael Musto receives Village Voice column
COMMERCIAL: Spur Production
5. 1984 Halloween coverage/ Closing credits

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News - highlights:
1. Interview with Nancy Roth, Executive Director, Gay Rights National Lobby, discussing anti-discrimination in immigration policy
COMMERCIAL: Carnaval in Rio de Janeiro, Islanders' Club
2. City status granted to West Hollywood, California; city council is formed
3. Anti-gay Texas Senator Phil [Graham] wins election
4. Gay Rights bill passed in Houston, Texas, but may be overturned
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
5. Interview with David Bender, campaigner, discussing the win of Massachusetts' openly gay Senator Gary Studds
COMMERCIAL: New York Gay Film Festival
6. National Gay Task Force meeting
COMMERCIAL: "The Connection," gay and lesbian newspaper
7. Interview with Pastor Karen Zeigler, Metropolitan Community Church, discusses meeting with National Council of Churches
COMMERCIAL: "The Times of Harvey Milk"
8. First census of a gay community, San Francisco
COMMERCIAL: Chamberlain and Associates, career service professionals
9. Carol Bellamy, announcement of upcoming appearance
COMMERCIAL: Arcos Blancos, San Juan, Puerto Rico
10. Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Christopher Collins, attorney, discusses the start of Community Health Project
COMMERCIAL: "Badlands," a NYC gay bar
11. Sports Report/ closing
The Right Stuff:
1. Media Report/ Current Events
COMMERCIAL: Carnaval in Rio de Janeiro, Islanders' Club
2. Terry Miller interviews Quentin Crisp, author/ performer
COMMERCIAL: "The Times of Harvey Milk"
3. Quentin Crisp interview continued
COMMERCIAL: National Fund for Human Dignity for disabled gays and lesbians
4. Preview of upcoming gay motion picture, "Whispers"
COMMERCIAL: Rio Adventure, Orpheo travel agency
5. Interview with Ron Gould, producer of gay film "Whispers"/ closing credits

Pride and Progress
News - highlights:

2. National Gay Task Force, interviews with members Peter Fowler and Evelyn White
COMMERCIAL: "The Times of Harvey Milk"
COMMERCIAL: "The Connection," gay and lesbian newspaper
3. Interview with Keith O'Connor, NYC Human Rights Commission, discussing anti-gay discrimination bill in NYC
COMMERCIAL: Carnaval in Rio de Janiero, The Islanders Club
4. Report on Executive Order 50; employment rights for city contractors
COMMERCIAL: New York Gay Film Festival
5. U.S. Court of Appeals for District of Columbia refused to hear case of expelled gay navy officer
6. Community announcements
COMMERCIAL: Arco Blancos resort, San Juan, Puerto Rico
7. Heathline: Conversations with GMHC: Topic: AIDS Assessment Program of Community Health Project. Interview with Dr. Ted Lazarus, clinical coordinator AIDS Assessment Program, and Rona Affoumado, Admin. Director, Community Health Project

COMMERCIAL: "The Times of Harvey Milk"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content

Pride and Progress
News - highlights:
1. A recap of some of the major LGBT events of 1984. Clips include:
2. Original "Stonewallers" at Pride Parade
3. Bella Abzug speech at Greater Gotham Business Meeting
COMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp
4. Virginia Apuzzo on LGBT presence at Democratic National Convention
5. VP candidate Geraldine Ferraro at Democratic National Convention on human rights
6. Maureen Reagan, daughter of President, interviewed at Republican National Convention
COMMERCIAL: Carnaval in Rio de Janeiro, Islanders' Club

8. David Rothenberg campaign speech
10. Speech by Victor Gotbaum, Director DC 37, AFSCME
COMMERCIAL: World of Video
11. [Fairpack], a new political gay action committee
12. Reports on AIDS in 1984
COMMERCIAL: Chamberlain and Associates, career service professionals
13. Report on gays on television in 1984, including Showtime's cable series "Brothers"
14. Gay youth
16. Acquisition of NYC's LGBT Community Center on West 13th Street
15. Wrap up of 1984 events
COMMERCIAL: Disc-o-rama, NY video and music store
16. Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Michael Shernoff, Chelsea Psychotherapy, discusses how to deal with friends who have AIDS
17. Closing credits

1. Performance by the Big Apple Corps Band with the Pink Panther
COMMERCIAL: "The Gascon," a novel by John Colin Penford

COMMERCIAL: Disc-o-rama, NY video and music store

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News - highlights:
1. Virginia Supreme Court child custody suit
COMMERCIAL: Chamberlain and Associates, career service professionals
2. Tom Stoddard, Legislative Director of New York Civil Liberties Union, on legality of gay relationships
3. Federal Gay Rights Bill reintroduced in U.S. House of Representatives
COMMERCIAL: "The Connection," gay and lesbian newspaper
4. Interview with Jeff Snow and Bonnie McGinley, spokepersons for Concerned Americans for Individual Rights
5. The American Automobile Association in Wisconsin extends its benefits to gay couples
6. Salvation Army in Wisconsin loses contract when it refuses to sign anti-discrimination clause
7. Andy Humm discusses anti-gay rights activist, John J. O'Connor, Catholic Archbishop of New York
COMMERCIAL: Disc-o-rama, NY video and music store
8. Interview with Brent Nicholson, head of The American Run for the End of AIDS
9. Sports Report
COMMERCIAL: Actor/ playwright Harvey Fierstein announces his return to "Torch Song Trilogy" at the Helen Hayes Theatre
10. Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Elaine Noble, Addiction Recovery Corp. member, discusses alcohol and drug addiction in the gay community
11. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:
1. Media reports/current events
COMMERCIAL: "The Gascon," a novel by John Colin Penford
2. Valentine's Day edition of "Season's Eatings" with Joe Alleva
COMMERCIAL: "Manscape," a gay magazine
3. Interview with Robert Rios, director of Dallas production of "Boys in the Band"
COMMERCIAL: Disc-o-rama, NY video and music store
3. On the Streets with Jon
4. Closing credits

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content

Pride and Progress
