daodesc.p:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 5 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 1/26/1987]: January 1987

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, Darrell Yates Rist, and Evan Wolfson
2. Discussion of gays voting for anti-gay political leaders
COMMERCIAL: Stamp Out AIDS featuring Jennifer Bassey
3. Congress looks into banning cigarette ads, and the regulation of private decisions by government
4. Re-opening gay bathhouses and the ethics of this
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
5. Andy Humm on Catholic conservatives intervening in the youth sex education
6. News Briefs, In Seattle, Oregon's human rights commission prohibits discrimination against persons with AIDS
7. Connecticut's first housing complex exclusively for people with AIDS raises $30,000
8. AZT drug available only in limited supply when it becomes available
9. Chinese government requires foreign students to take HTLVIII virus test
10. Austin city council passes anti-discrimination bill
11. South Korea requires mandatory AIDS testing for all employees of service industries
12. Sports Report
13. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:
1. This Week in Gay History, with Jeff Bixby
COMMERCIAL: "Manscape" gay magazine
COMMERCIAL: The Monster
2. Media Watch with Brandon Judell, announcements
3. Interview with Michael Petrelis a resident of the Bailey House for people with AIDS
COMMERCIAL: The World of Video
4. Show Bits, George Trahanis reviews Broadway play, "Stepping Out," with clips
COMMERCIAL: Zamir Furs
5. Conclusion of Michael Weyand's interview of Walter Williams, author of "The Spirit in the Flesh"
6. Closing credits

did.unittitle:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 6 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 2/2/1987]

dao.xlink:title: [1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 6 [2]--The Right Stuff <lb/>[Air Date: 2/2/1987]

daodesc.p:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 6 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 2/2/1987]: February 1987

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, Darrell Yates Rist, Kitty Cotter, and Jim Levin
2. Short news stories
3. Gay Catholic group petitions New York City for the right to demonstrate outside of St. Patrick's Cathedral
4. Discussion of publicly-closeted gay politicians courting the gay vote
5. Accurate government reporting of AIDS, and the privacy issues involved in listing AIDS on death certificates
COMMERCIAL: Stamp Out AIDS featuring Jennifer Bassey
6. Andy Humm on Reagan's Education secretary, William Bennett, opposing AIDS Education programs in schools
7. News Watch, Colorado lawmakers ready to approve the testing, tracing, and quarantining individuals suspected of being infected with HIV
8. San Francisco, Chronicle discloses its policy prohibiting the listing of surviving lovers in death notices
9. ACLU considering suing nursing homes in Illinois that refuse to accept persons with AIDS
10. Dutch National Broadcasting Service has begun a television service for lesbians and gay men
11. Paper finds that certain DNA viruses have the ability to activate latent AIDS viruses
12. Senator Edward Kennedy promises adequate AIDS budget beyond Reagan's lackluster budget
13. Sports Report
14. New segment Lavender Health, presented by the Office of Gay and Lesbian Health Concerns of the New York City Department of Health, discussion of AIDS-phobia
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
15. George Trahanis interviews Jeff Goodman, Secretary of the Board of the Greater Gotham Business Council
16. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:
1. This Week in Gay History, with Jeff Bixby
COMMERCIAL: "Manscape" gay magazine
COMMERCIAL: The Monster
2. GCN Cincinnati TV episode, "Georgia Vice"
COMMERCIAL: Zamir Furs
3. Show Bits with George Trahanis, review of Broadway musical "Beehive"
4. COMMERCIAL: Night of a Thousand Gowns charity ball
5. Olivia Negron interviews Gerard Ilaria, a volunteer social worker at New York Hospital and Columbia University Gay Health Advocacy Project
6. Razor Sharp introduces a contest to win a date with her

did.unittitle:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 7 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 2/10/1987]

dao.xlink:title: [1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 7 [2]--The Right Stuff <lb/>[Air Date: 2/10/1987]

daodesc.p:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 7 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 2/10/1987]: February 1987

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, Darrell Yates Rist, Joyce Hunter, and Jim Levin
2. Short news stories
3. Updates about the March on Washington, including discussion of the demands of community on government
COMMERCIAL: Night of a Thousand Gowns charity drag ball
3. Criticism of GMHC's lack of an active political front, and emphasis on social service in the community
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
4. Gay rights advocate and psychiatrist, Emery Hetrick's obituary
5. News Watch, a study by the University of California, Berkeley finds that gay men who only engage in oral sex or insertive anal intercourse have a lower risk of contracting AIDS virus
6. Philadelphia, a gay city employee charges the city with violation of its gay rights law by not allowing his lover certain rights
7. San Francisco, openly gay Tom Nolan elected President of the San Mateo Board of Supervisors
8. People traveling to Mexico to buy experimental AIDS treatment drugs will be prosecuted to the fullest extent of the law as drug smugglers
9. Warren, Michigan, mayor bans local cable company from airing gay program "The Lambda Report" on its public access channel
10. San Francisco, two former members of the satirical protest group, The Sisters of Perpetual Indulgence, register legally as the "official San Francisco 1987 papal welcoming committee"
11. Sports Report
COMMERCIAL: Stamp Out AIDS featuring Jennifer Bassey
12. Lavender Health, interview with Stephen Schaefer, coordinator of the AIDS Hotline
13. George Trahanis's closing statement
14. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:
1. This Week in Gay History, with Jeff Bixby
COMMERCIAL: The Monster
2. Show Bits with George Trahanis, review of "Blue is for Boys" and interview with actor, Allen Gassman
COMMERCIAL: Zamir Furs
3. Media Watch with Brandon Judell, short news stories
4. Judell interviews Canadian comedian, Lorne Elliott
COMMERCIAL: Night of a Thousand Gowns charity drag ball
5. Razor Sharp introduces a contest to win a date with her
6. Olivia Negron, closing statements
7. Closing credits

did.unittitle:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 8 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 2/17/1987]

[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 9 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 2/23/1987] [3]--Men and Films, Episode No. 9

dao.xlink:title: [1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 9 [2]--The Right Stuff <lb/>[Air Date: 2/23/1987] [3]--Men and Films, Episode No. 9

daodesc.p:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 9 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 2/23/1987] [3]--Men and Films, Episode No. 9: February 1987

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, Darrell Yates Rist, and Tim Coglin
2. Short news stories
3. New York Native reports that AIDS caused by syphilis spirochetes
COMMERCIAL: Night of a Thousand Gowns charity drag ball
4. Catholic Church ejecting gay groups from their churches and forbidding them to meet or worship there
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
5. Andy Humm on the marriage of an ex-gay man with AIDS in a Catholic Church
6. News Watch, bill introduced in Maryland to remove state's sodomy laws
7. LAMBDA legal defense hires a third attorney to full-time staff to deal exclusively with AIDS-related issues
8. Chicago, low income gays suffer discrimination at a greater rate and degree
9. New York, judge rules that funeral homes charging more for burial of AIDS victims are doing so illegally
10. San Francisco, Mayor Diane Feinstein announces a reward for information leading to the arrest of the murderer of two gay men in the city's Castro district in December of 1986
11. Arizona governor, Evan Mecham, declares that homosexuality is not a valid alternative lifestyle and therefore has no place in any argument concerning human rights
12. Sports Report
13. Lavender Health, interview with Dr. Joan Waitkevicz of the lesbian-centered St. Marks Women's Health Collective
14. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:
1. Media Watch with Brandon Judell, interview with William H. Hoffman, playwright of "As Is," with clips of the television film
COMMERCIAL: Zamir Furs
2. Show Bits with George Trahanis, review of "Vicki's Valentine Thing," with clips
COMMERCIAL: Night of a Thousand Gowns charity drag ball
3. Razor Sharp introduces a contest to win a date with her
COMMERCIAL: The Monster
4. Closing credits

did.unittitle:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 10 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 3/2/1987]

daodesc.p:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 10 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 3/2/1987]: March 1987

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, Eleanor Cooper, and Christopher [Wolfe]
2. Short news stories
3. Discussion of condom distribution and the public airing of condom ads on network television, getting the gay community "condom comfortable"
COMMERCIAL: Jose Sarria for SF AIDS Foundation
4. Mandatory testing for HIV for those working in the public sector
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
5. Andy Humm demonstrates proper condom use
6. News Watch, Chicago Resource Center awards National Coalition of Black Lesbians and Gays $10,000 to support their magazine, "Black Out"
7. California Fair Employment and Housing Commission unanimously rules persons with AIDS protected against discrimination on the job
8. New Hepatitis B vaccine not derived from human blood products now in mass production and widely available
9. BBC cancels plans to air a two part educational drama on homosexuality due to heated public debate on sex education in schools
10. Sports Report
11. Lavender Health, interview with Richard Burns, executive director of the Lesbian and Gay Communi
The Right Stuff:
1. This Week in Gay History, with Jeff Bixby
COMMERCIAL: Zamir Furs
2. Media Watch with Brandon Judell, announcement of Robert Latourneau's death, clips from "Boys in the Band"
3. The late Arthur Bell's interview of Robert Latourneau from the "Emerald City Tapes"
COMMERCIAL: Night of a Thousand Gowns charity drag ball
4. Show Bits, George Trahanis reviews the off-Broadway production, "The Musical Comedy Murders of 1940"
COMMERCIAL: SF AIDS Foundation
COMMERCIAL: Judge Steven Lachs for the NGTF Fund for Human Dignity
5. Closing credits

did.unittitle:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 11 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 3/6/1987]

daodesc.p:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 11 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 3/6/1987]: March 1987

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, Darrell Yates Rist, and Jim Levin, sponsored by the Human Rights Campaign Fund
2. Short news stories
3. Discussion of the Center for Disease Control Conference in Atlanta, and the growing nuance in AIDS discussion
COMMERCIAL: SF AIDS Foundation
4. Discussion of the radical Lavender Hill Mob movement and its public disturbance as a protest method
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
5. Andy Humm on the conflict between organized religion and homosexuality
6. News Watch, Delaware State Insurance Commission approves gay-sensitive health insurance guidelines
7. Chicago, "gay dollar" stamps now sold by mail
8. National Gay Rights Advocates publish a tax guide for gay and lesbian men and women
9. California's State Association of Health calls for the isolated quarantining of those who are AIDS and HIV positive and are willfully spreading the virus
10. Sports Report, interview with two members of the Big Apple Softball League
COMMERCIAL: Night of a Thousand Gowns charity drag ball
11. Lavender Health, interview with John Thacker, director of the NYC Department of Health's Sexually Transmitted Disease Education Service
12. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:
1. This Week in Gay History, with Jeff Bixby
COMMERCIAL: Zamir Furs
2. Media Watch with Brandon Judell, interview with actor Taylor Mead, clips from Andy Warhol's "Frankenstein"
3. Show Bits with George Trahanis, review of "Mona Rogers in Person," with clips
COMMERCIAL: Night of a Thousand Gowns charity drag ball
4. Interview series on the operating methods of GMHC, with playwright Larry Kramer, and a response by the executive director of GMHC, Richard Dunne
5. Closing credits over the end of Dunne's response which is cut off

did.unittitle:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 12 [2]--The Right Stuff

[Air Date: 3/13/1987]: March 1987

phystech.head: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, Darrell Yates Rist, Joyce Hunter, and Jim Levin, sponsored by the Human Rights Campaign Fund
2. Short news stories
3. Discussion of Catholic Archdiocese's banning of Catholic gay rights groups from churches
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
4. One year anniversary of the passing of New York City's gay right bill, with clips from GCN's coverage of the event, and discussion of the progress of gay rights since the bill
COMMERCIAL: SF AIDS Foundation
5. Andy Humm on the growing participation of the gay community in activism
6. News Watch, Vatican newspaper criticizes condom use as a method of stopping spread of AIDS, advocating the stopping of gay sex
7. Seattle Times rejects an ad from Parents and Friends of Lesbians and Gays, due to the use of the word "gay"
8. Vermont, gay rights bill introduced in state legislature
9. Delta Airlines avoids national gay boycott after Delta agrees to meet demands of gay group, including non-discrimination of passengers with AIDS
10. Sports Report, with clips from the Dr. Ruth show
11. Lavender Health, interview with Felicia Schady, public health educator with the Hepatitis B Prevention Unit at the NYC Health Department
12. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:
1. This Week in Gay History, with Jeff Bixby
COMMERCIAL: Night of a Thousand Gowns charity drag ball
s
2. Media Watch with Brandon Judell, interview with Helen [Schumaker], actress in the one-woman show, "Mona Rogers in Person," with clips
COMMERCIAL: Zamir Furs
3. Show Bits with George Trahanis, review of Barbara Gelb's two-act, one-character play "My Gene"
COMMERCIAL: "Manscape" gay magazine
4. Second part of the interview series on the operating methods of GMHC, with playwright Larry Kramer, and a response by the executive director of GMHC, Richard Dunne, tape cuts off

did.unittitle:

daodesc.p:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 13 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 3/20/1987]: March 1987

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, Darrell Yates Rist, and Jim Levin, sponsored by the Human Rights Campaign Fund
2. Short news stories
3. Discussion of the increasing activism within the gay community, ties to "civil disobedience," and how to encourage new faces to join the protest
COMMERCIAL: Human Rights Campaign Fund
4. New York Times reports that Southern voters are extremely concerned with AIDS as a priority issue, discussion of how the AIDS issue will be used by politicians in the 1988 election
COMMERCIAL: SF AIDS Foundation, with Jose Sarria
5. Andy Humm on the AIDS education of teenagers
6. News Watch, new study shows that the longer a person is infected with HIV, the greater their chance is of developing AIDS
7. Madison Avenue advertising firm denounce remark by Lifestyles Condoms, who stated "AIDS is a condom-marketers dream"
8. AZT renamed to Retrovir, to limit confusion in foreign countries where AZT is the name of an immuno-suppressant
9. Sacramento Union publishes profile of gay male couple for Valentine series, and receives complaints
10. Sports Report
11. Lavender Health, interview with Liz [Walker], head of Domestic Violence Services at NYC Gay and Lesbian Anti-Violence Project
12. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:
1. This Week in Gay History, with Jeff Bixby
COMMERCIAL: Night of a Thousand Gowns charity drag ball
2. Show Bits with George Trahanis, review of Barbara Lea's cabaret show, "The Melody Lingers On"
COMMERCIAL: Zamir Furs
3. Naming Names segment, exposing persons in the media who misrepresent gay and lesbian people, sponsored by GLAAD: John Cardinal O'Connor
COMMERCIAL: "Suds" gay soap opera, created by GCN
4. Media Watch with Brandon Judell, interview with Stephen McCauley, author of "Object of My Affection"
COMMERCIAL: Night of a Thousand Gowns charity drag ball
5. Third part of the interview series on the operating methods of GMHC, with playwright Larry Kramer, and a response by the executive director of GMHC, Richard Dunne, tape cuts off

[Air Date: 3/27/1987]

daodesc.p:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 14 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 3/27/1987]: March 1987

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Coverage by Andy Humm of the AIDS crisis demonstration at Trinity Church on March 24, 1987, interview with Larry Kramer
2. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, Darrell Yates Rist, and Jim Levin, sponsored by the Human Rights Campaign Fund
3. Short news stories, appeal for donations
3. Discussion of the New York Times coverage of AIDS issue, quality of series and whether it was timely or too-little-too-late
COMMERCIAL: Human Rights Campaign Fund
4. Continued discussion of New York Times AIDS coverage
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
5. Andy Humm on New York City's AIDS education
6. News Watch, Senator Pete Wilson introduces a bill to create a Congressional Advisory Panel on AIDS, headed by the National Academy of Sciences
7. Senator Dan Burton of Indiana proposes a bill for mandatory annual HIV testing for all US residents
8. New York, Queens co-op agrees to let a gay couple purchase an apartment after the couple went to the city's Commission on Human Rights
9. Congressional Hearing on AIDS Education finds that Federal response to AIDS epidemic is "slow, limited, and ultimately impotent"
10. Sports Report
11. Lavender Health, interview with Dava Weinstein, social worker, and co-chair of "10% of Those We Serve" chemical dependency conference
12. George Trahanis announces GCN's 5th anniversary, and a new pledge drive
13. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:
1. Episode of GCN's soap opera, "Suds": "A Farewell to Tom"
2. Closing credits

did.unittitle:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 15 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 4/7/1987]

dao.xlink:title: [1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 15 [2]--The Right Stuff<lb/>[Air Date: 4/7/1987]

daodesc.p:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 15 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 4/7/1987]: April 1987

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, Darrell Yates Rist, Kitty Cotter, and Jim Levin, sponsored by the Human Rights Campaign Fund
2. Discussion of the 1987 National Lesbian and Gay Health Conference, and AIDS in politics overtaking gay rights issues
COMMERCIAL: Human Rights Campaign Fund
3. Discussion of the AIDS and HIV tests, and personal issues surrounding testing
4. Andy Humm on "straightening up" a home to hide a homosexual lifestyle
5. News Watch, Georgia State Representative shelves legislation to criminalize homosexual sodomy due to controversy created
6. "Names Project," a quilt of the names of those killed by AIDS to be displayed on Washington Mall during the March on Washington
7. Philadelphia school-board condemns harassment of students based on sexual orientation, provides "sensitivity training" for teachers and administrators
8. Independent Catholic newspaper estimates that 50% of Catholic priests in the US are homosexual
9. Sports Report
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
10. Lavender Health, interview with Mary Anne Chaisson, member of the Department of Health's AIDS research unit, which collects data and tracks the epidemic in NYC
11. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:
1. Naming Names, Lifestyles and Trojan Condoms criticized for calling AIDS "a condom-makers dream" and refusing to advertise in gay publications
COMMERCIAL: 10th Annual Awards Evening for the Fund for Human Dignity
2. Media Watch, with Brandon Judell, interview with John Dietrich of the Islanders Club, an adventure-oriented club
COMMERCIAL: GCN Fundraiser
3. Episode of GCN's soap opera, "Suds": "See Spot Run"
4. Closing credits
5. COMMERCIAL: GCN Fundraiser

[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 17 [2]--The Right Stuff

[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 17 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 4/20/1987]: April 1987

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, Darrell Yates Rist, Joyce Hunter, and Jim Levin, sponsored by the Human Rights Campaign Fund
2. Announcement of GCN Pledge Month
3. Discussion of openly-gay Harry Britt's loss to Nancy Pelosi for the position of Californian Democratic member of Congress, discussion of gay politicians and the gay voting block
COMMERCIAL: Human Rights Campaign Fund
4. Vice-President George Bush finally takes a stance on AIDS prevention and education, but only in the private sphere, also the outspokenness of Surgeon General Everett Koop
5. AIDS organizations in Puerto Rico
COMMERCIAL: GCN Fundraiser
6. Anti-gay prejudice and heterosexual bias
7. News Watch, Georgetown University persuades a Maryland state representative a bill to give them funding for an expansion, after the university refused to comply with Washington DC's human rights law
8. Idaho requires those applying for a marriage license to be tested for HIV
9. Moscow, USSR opens an anonymous AIDS testing site for foreigners and those who have had sex with foreigners
10. Britain's Princess Diana opens the country's first AIDS ward, in order to dispel myth of infection by close contact
COMMERCIAL: 10th Annual Awards Evening for the Fund for Human Dignity
11. Sports Report, on location with The Times Squares, a gay-oriented square dance group
12. Lavender Health, interview with Karen Solomon, a coordinator of the AIDS Counseling and Testing Site of the NYC Department of Health, discussion of HIV test
13. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:
1. Show Bits with George Trahanis, review of Broadway production of Harvey Fierstein's three one-acts, "Safe Sex"
2. Media Watch with Brandon Judell, interview with [Frederick] Davies, star of the one-man show, "The Great Truman Capote"
3. Episode of GCN's soap opera, "Suds": "Catching Up is Hard to Do"
4. Closing credits

did.unittitle:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 18 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 4/27/1987]

daodesc.p:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 18 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 4/27/1987]: April 1987

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, Darrell Yates Rist, NYU student David Strah, and Jim Levin, sponsored by the Human Rights Campaign Fund
2. Announcement of GCN Pledge Month
3. Discussion of Brooklyn College refusal to give award to anti-gay Catholic Bishop Francis J. Mugavero, the political backlash against Brooklyn College's decision, and how the gay community can confront religious bigotry
COMMERCIAL: GCN Fundraiser
4. Condom availability in prisons and in colleges, whether condoms are "catching on"
COMMERCIAL: Human Rights Campaign Fund
5. Andy Humm on the necessity of activists and volunteers in the gay community
6. News Watch, anti-gay psychologist Paul Cameron changes the name of his organization to "The Family Research Institute"
7. Oklahoma, Republican Party platform is anti-gay, despite the Republican governor's approval of sex education in schools
8. Hollywood, television shows and films win awards at the Alliance for Gay and Lesbian Artists awards for positive portrayals of gay characters
9. Dallas police arm selves with gloves, masks, and insect repellent due to fear of contracting AIDS
10. Clips from a speech by New York Governor Mario Cuomo, on the passage of an executive order for the protection of gay and lesbian employees
COMMERCIAL: Dancing Cheek to Cheek GCN event
11. Lavender Health, interview with Damien Martin, co-founder of the Institute for the Protection of Lesbian and Gay Youth and Professor at New York University, about specific needs in educating gay youths
12. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:
1. Media Watch with Brandon Judell, short stories and clip of Mayor Koch talking about Ronald Reagan's inactivity regarding AIDS funding
COMMERCIAL: GCN Fundraiser
2. Naming Names, criticism of Max Frankel of the New York Times
3. Episode 5 of GCN's soap opera, "Suds": "A Brief Crisis"
4. Closing credits

[Air Date: 5/15/1987]: May 1987

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, David Strah, Phil Reed, and Jim Levin, sponsored by the Human Rights Campaign Fund
2. "Condom Consciousness Day" at NYU, distribution of condoms
3. President Reagan and his non-stance on AIDS testing, and public policy
COMMERCIAL: GCN Fundraiser
4. Discussion of politicians in-the-running for the Democratic nomination and their pro or anti-gay stance
COMMERCIAL: Human Rights Campaign Fund
5. News Watch, AIDS drug, DDC, enters preliminary human testing
6. Record book of 500 people tested for the HIV virus has been stolen, presumably by blackmailers
7. Alliance for Gay and Lesbian Artists closes its offices and lays off its staff
8. Coverage and clips from NYC's "Stamp Out AIDS Day"
9. Sports Report
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
10. Lavender Health, interview with Donna Futterman, pediatrician and co-author of a lesbian parenting book
11. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:
1. Show Bits with George Trahanis, review of "Waving Goodbye"
COMMERCIAL: "Manscape" gay magazine
2. Naming Names, criticism of Jerry Falwell
COMMERCIAL: The Monster
3. South Padre Island, Texas, gay resort location Lyle's Deck
4. Episode 8 of GCN's soap opera, "Suds": "Fit for a Queen"
5. Closing credits

[Air Date: 5/26/1987]: May 1987

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, David Strah, Joyce Hunter, and Christopher Lynn, sponsored by the Human Rights Campaign Fund
2. Discussion of the lawsuit against Governor Cuomo's "anti-sex guidelines"
3. Discussion of gay activism against anti-gay politicians and finding allies in politics
COMMERCIAL: GCN Fundraiser
4. Balancing sex education and AIDS education for children and young adults
COMMERCIAL: Human Rights Campaign Fund
5. Andy Humm on politicians advocating abstinence to counter AIDS
6. News Watch, CDC adds dementia and emaciation to AIDS symptoms
7. Holland, upscale condom boutique opens on outskirts of Amsterdam's red light district
8. Smoking found to possibly cause impotence
9. A Florida man goes on a shooting rampage because he believed that some people thought he was gay
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
10. Sports Report
COMMERCIAL: GCN Fundraiser
11. Lavender Health, Ron Vauchon with Ellen Zaltzberg discussing various conferences centered around gay health issues
12. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:
1. Show Bits with George Trahanis, interview with Bob Bowyer of the off-Broadway show, "Funny Feet"
COMMERCIAL: The Monster
2. Olivia Negron interviews Karen Abbott and Bob Werner, two activists who placed pro-gay stickers around "Heritage USA," the park owned by Tammy Faye and Jim Bakker
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
3. Interview with Joe di Sabito about condom companies avoiding advertising in gay media
COMMERCIAL: GCN Fundraiser
4. Media Watch with Brandon Judell, interview with Mark Thompson, author and cultural editor of "The Advocate" magazine

did.unittitle:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 23 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 5/29/1987]

[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 24 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 6/5/1987]

dao.xlink:title: [1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 24 [2]--The Right Stuff<lb/>[Air Date: 6/5/1987]

daodesc.p:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 24 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 6/5/1987]: June 1987

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, David Strah, Joyce Hunter, and Jim Levin, sponsored by the Human Rights Campaign Fund
2. Updates regarding the National March on Washington for Lesbian and Gay Rights
3. Discussion of a new biography of Leonard Bernstein that outs him and multiple others in his circle, and the status of closeted celebrities
COMMERCIAL: GCN Fundraiser
4. Ronald Reagan and George Bush booed after speaking in favor of mandatory AIDS testing, also necessity of having medical professionals discuss the issues, and not politicians
COMMERCIAL: Human Rights Campaign Fund
5. Andy Humm on Mario Cuomo and Ed Koch "getting tough" on AIDS and the issue of mandatory testing
6. Clips from President Reagan and Vice-President George Bush's speeches on mandatory testing, booing of audience, and clips from the June 1st 1987 protest in front of the White House
7. News Watch, French researchers discover second, genetically different strain of HIV which also causes AIDS
8. "The San Francisco Chronicle" apologizes for omitting the names of surviving homosexual partners in obituaries
9. In a national poll, AIDS is found to be the third greatest fear of youths aged 8-17, behind only kidnapping and nuclear war, with 65% saying they are "very concerned" with AIDS, and other statistics
10. Liberace's estate sues Riverside County, CA as the coroner's linking the star's death with AIDS damaged his posthumous reputation
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
11. Sports Report
COMMERCIAL: Lesbian and Gay Community Services Center
12. Lavender Health, interview with Rona Affoumado, clinic coordinator of the Community Health Project
13. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:
1. Naming Names, criticism of The New York Times, Sunday Magazine
COMMERCIAL: Heritage of Pride, 24-hour Dance Marathon
2. Show Bits with George Trahanis, interview with David Drake of "Vampire Lesbians of Sodom"
COMMERCIAL: The Monster
3. Rebroadcast of Episode 6 of GCN's soap opera, "Suds": "Jock's Itch"
4. Closing credits

daodesc.p:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 25 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 6/12/1987]: June 1987

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, David Strah, and Maureen Brady, sponsored by the Human Rights Campaign Fund
2. Conversation with Congressman Ted Weiss, chief sponsor of the Federal Lesbian and Gay Rights Bill, and advocate for greater AIDS funding
COMMERCIAL: Lesbian and Gay Community Services Center Fundraiser
3. Continued conversation with Ted Weiss
COMMERCIAL: Human Rights Campaign Fund
4. Andy Humm on Mayor Ed Koch's defense of Cardinal O'Connor and sponsorship of abstinence-only AIDS education
5. News Watch, AIDS-positive man in Birmingham, Alabama spits in the face of a baby, which City Council attempts to classify this as "attempted murder," although a member of the Alabama State Health Department declares transmission by spitting "very unlikely"
6. A federal lawsuit has been brought against Prudential Insurance Company by a business-owner who was tested for HIV antibodies without his knowledge or consent
7. William Hoffman, the playwright of "As Is," criticizes PBS for refusing to air the movie-version of the play due to the possible reaction of Southern stations to the positive depiction of a gay relationship
8. West Seneca, New York, board approves changing the name of "Gay Drive" to "Fawn Trail" due to resident's disapproval
COMMERCIAL: GCN Fundraiser
9. Sports Report
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
10. Lavender Health, interview with Michael Baker, interagency planner of the NYC Department of Health
11. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:
1. Naming Names, criticism of anti-gay extremist Paul Cameron
COMMERCIAL: Interart Theatre
2. Rebroadcast of Episode 7 [misidentified on tape by announcer] of GCN's soap opera, "Suds": "Poetry in Motion"
3. Closing credits

did.unittitle:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 26 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 6/22/1987]

dao.xlink:title: [1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 26 [2]--The Right Stuff<lb/>[Air Date: 6/22/1987]

daodesc.p:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 26 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 6/22/1987]: June 1987

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, Jim Levin, Jean Elizabeth Glass, and Lou Maletta, sponsored by the Human Rights Campaign Fund
2. Short news stories
3. Interview with Lou Maletta on the Stonewall Riots of June 28th, 1969
COMMERCIAL: GCN Fundraiser
4. Continuation of discussion about the effects of Stonewall on the current gay community and gay advocacy
COMMERCIAL: Human Rights Campaign Fund
5. Andy Humm on Bishop Emerson Moore and his hypocrisy speaking against gay rights as a gay man
6. News Watch, the Boston Lesbian and Gay Alliance is pushing for the city to hire gays as police due to a seven-fold increase in violence against homosexuals
7. 6 year study in Sweden allows for the passage of a bill granting long-term homosexual couples the same rights as common law marriages
8. Police wear bright yellow gloves to arrest pro-gay protesters in Washington DC, but South Carolinian police wear anti-AIDS suits against the perceived treat of contracting the virus
9. The Beastie Boys made anti-gay comments in a music magazine, so their recording label, CBS Records, donated $2000 to the Gay and Lesbian Anti-Violence Project
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
10. Sports Report
11. Lavender Health, interview with Aaron Rudner, Deafness Project Director at the Institute for the Protection of Lesbian and Gay Youth
12. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:
1. Olivia Negron interviews Peggy Shaw and Lois Weaver, two founders of the lesbian performance troupe, "Split Britches"
COMMERCIAL: The Monster
2. Show Bits with George Trahanis, review of cabaret show, "The Wallowitching Hour"
3. Rebroadcast of Episode 8 of GCN's soap opera, "Suds": "Fit for a Queen"
4. Media Watch with Brandon Judell, announcement of playwright Charles Ludlam's death, clips from a performance of his play, "The Ventriloquist's Wife"
5. Olivia Negron announces important numbers to call, closing credits

[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 27 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: unknown]: circa 1987

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, Jim Levin, and David Strah, sponsored by the Human Rights Campaign Fund
2. Discussion of Ed Koch's decision to honor anti-gay bishop, Francis Mugavero, despite Brooklyn College refusing to honor the bishop, including clips of Koch defending his decision
COMMERCIAL: GCN Fundraiser
3. Discussion of love lives in the age of AIDS, and changes to sexual behavior of the community
COMMERCIAL: Human Rights Campaign Fund
4. Andy Humm on coming out
5. News Watch, study by Johns Hopkins of 5000 homosexual men finds sexual activities and lifestyles changing, including increases in celibacy, condom usage, and monogamous relationships, also finds a decrease in sexual partners
6. 12 remaining Los Angeles bathhouses required to follow new safe-sex guidelines that prohibit certain activities such as anal sex without a condom, and anonymous group sex, while sponsoring AIDS education
7. Florida boy committed by a judge to a psychiatric ward because he was HIV positive and remained sexually active
8. Homosexual man fired from the National Security Assosciation for being "psychologically unstable" wins the right to a trial
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
9. Sports Report, clips from a spoof exercise video starring Ferdinand Marcos and other dictators
10. Lavender Health, interview with Cook Friedman, director of the group Education in a Disabled Gay Environment
11. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:
1. Naming Names, criticism of Steven Weinstock, producer of WNET television program "Currents"
COMMERCIAL: The Monster
2. Show Bits with George Trahanis, review of Alan Bowne's play, "Beirut"
COMMERCIAL: "Take a Ferry on the Fourth" event
3. Media Watch with Brandon Judell, interview with the stars of "Beirut," Michael David Morrison and Laura San Giacomo
4. Rebroadcast of Episode 9 of GCN's soap opera, "Suds": "Hair Today, Gone Tomorrow"
5. Closing credits

2. Special hour long coverage of Gay Pride '87
COMMERCIAL: Human Rights Campaign Fund
3. Footage and interviews at the Gay Pride Parade '87
COMMERCIAL: GCN Fundraiser
4. Lavendar Health, Interview with David Wertheimer from the Governor's Task Force on Bias Related Violence
COMMERCIAL: "First Hand" gay magazine
5.GCN's soap opera, "Suds": "East Meets West Side"
COMMERCIAL: The Monster
5.Closing credits

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, David Strah, Rev. Bernard Lynch and Eleanor Cooper, sponsored by the Human Rights Campaign Fund
COMMERCIAL: Human Rights Campaign Fund
2. Discussion about Catholicism and homosexuality.
COMMERCIAL: GCN Fundraiser
3.Discusson about the differences between the way gay and straight communities responded to the AIDS crisis.
4.News Watch, President Regan nominates Circuit Court of Appeals judge Robert H. Bork to the Supreme Court
5.Personal advertisment placed by Ft. Worth police department seen as a attack on homosexuality by ACLU and Gay Alliance
6.Committee of Outraged Lesbians (COOL) formed to combat racist or discriminatory practices in dance clubs urges the boycotting of events sponsored by Shescape Productions
7. New ruiling by FDA makes Investigational New Drugs (IND) available to people suffering from serious diseases, GCN contacts FDA to see how this affects people with AIDS
8.Lavender Health, Ellen Zaltzberg interviews Joe Stanton from Senior Action in Gay Enviornment (SAGE) about the services and history of the organization
9.Closing credits
The Right Stuff:
1. Naming Names, criticism of Natt Hemtoff's article which lambasts health professionals for not supporting mandatory testing for AIDS
COMMERCIAL: The Monster
2.GCN's soap opera, "Suds": "Hair Today, Gone Tomorrow Pt. 2"
COMMERCIAL: Manscape
5."Suds": "East Meets West Side"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, David Strah, Jewelle Gomez, and Darryl Yates-Rist, sponsored by the Human Rights Campaign Fund
2. Discussion about mandatory AIDS testing for everyone and coming out
COMMERCIAL: Human Rights Campaign Fund
3. Discussion with Darryl Yates-Rist about his travels across the USA and his experiences with various gay communities.
COMMERCIAL: GCN Fundraiser
4.Introduction of the group ACT-UP (AIDS Coalition to Unleash Power)
5.News watch, John Paul II's visit to San Francisco prompts antviolence statement between gay community leaders and the Roman Catholic Diocese of San Francisco
2. John [Wahlia] of Zambia, Africa is at a controversy for not sleeping with widowed sister-in-law whose husband died of AIDS
3. Rev. Rose Mary Denman, Methodist minister and lesbian takes a leave of abscense in a effort to change Methodist position on being a practicing gay minister
COMMERCIAL: L'image
5.GCN Sports, Dr. Tom Waddell, founder of Gay Games, died from complications due to AIDS, rundown of sports results, "Spy Magazine" report about an 18'' rubber penis in locker room, and clip of 16 year old gymnist Trent Davis
COMMERCIAL: First Hand
6. Lavender Health, Interview with David Worthheimer, Execuitve Director of Lesbian and Gay Anti-Violence Project, talks about organization.
7.Closing credits
The Right Stuff:
1. Naming Names, criticism of Regan nominee, US Circuit Court Judge Robert Bork to Supreme Court
COMMERCIAL:L'image
COMMERCIAL:Manscape
2.GCN soap opera "SUDS" episode, "Playmates"
COMMERCIAL:The Monster
COMMERCIAL:L'Image3.GCN soap opera, "SUDS" episode, "Playmates"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content

News-highlights:

2.Discussion about the AIDS panel appointed by President Regan, specifically Cardinal O'Connor and Frank Lilly
COMMERCIAL: Human Rights Campaign Fund
3.Footage and interviews from a four day ACT-UP demonstration at Sloane-Kettering regarding the National Institute of Health (NIH) scandal regarding the enrollment of AIDS Treatment Evaluation Units
COMMERCIAL: GCN Fundraiser
4.News Watch, Mississippi Circuit Court Judge suspended a man's sentence after it was disclosed that he had AIDS
5.Vigilanti squads killing people with HIV/AIDS in Brazil
6.Gay Community Focus with Chris Ford looks at organization HEAL (Health Education AIDS Liaison)
COMMERCIAL: L'image
7.GCN Sports, Announcement about the Big Apple Softball League, rundown of sports results, and Picturetime
COMMERCIAL:L'image
COMMERCIAL: First Hand
8.Lavendar Health, Interview with Karen Danard from the Condom Initative
9.Closing credits
The Right Stuff:
1. Naming Names, criticism of Reagan's AIDS panel
COMMERCIAL:The Monster
COMMERCIAL:Manscape
2.GCN soap opera "SUDS" episode, "Chapter 13"
COMMERCIAL:L'Image
COMMERCIAL:Manscape
3.GCN soap opera, "SUDS" episode, "Chapter 13"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, David Strah, Jim Levin and Philip Reed, member of the Minority Task Force, sponsored by the Human Rights Campaign Fund
2.Discussion about minorities with AIDS with footage of a protest outside of St. Patrick's Cathedral
COMMERCIAL: Prevention campaign by SWISS-AIDS-ASSISTANCE
3.Continuation of discussion on minorities with AIDS
COMMERCIAL: Human Rights Campaign Fund
4.James Minter, member of the Front Runners, talks about engaging political canidates on AIDS topics
5. News Watch, Man gets custody of his partners son after he dies of AIDS
6.Public pool closed after an HIV positive man swam in it in Williamson, West Virginia
COMMERCIAL: GCN Fundraiser
7.GCN Sports, Professional football teams offer voluntary AIDS testing for players, Tom Cousineau denies that he's gay, footage of diver Matt Scoggin and Greg Louganis
COMMERCIAL: First Hand
8.Lavender Health interview with Michael Shernoff, from Chelsea Psychotherapy Associates, talks about finding a therapist
9.Closing credits
The Right Stuff:
1. Show Bitz, discussion about the play, Steel Magnolias
COMMERCIAL: Manscape
2.Naming Names, criticism about the AIDS reporting of newspaper,"The Daily News"
COMMERCIAL: "Stop AIDS" The Swiss Federal Office of Public Health
3.Media Watch, Interview with pornographer and musican Chris Rage, features music video with footage of Rage's films
COMMERCIAL:The Monster
4.Inside Out, comedy sketch/satire where Sisky and Ebie look at homoeroticism in the film "The Color of Money" and "Top Gun"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content

Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, David Strah, Jim Levin and Mel Rosin, Director of the NY State AIDS Institute, sponsored by the Human Rights Campaign Fund
2.Discussion about how democrats Ed Koch and Governor Cuomo have dealt with the AIDS crisis.
COMMERCIAL: Prevention campaign by SWISS-AIDS-ASSISTANCE
3.Footage of "New York Post" AIDS Forum, August 6 at the Sheraton Hotel and discussion of New York City Mayor, Ed Koch's speech at the forum
COMMERCIAL: Human Rights Campaign Fund
4. NYC Council Members and opponents of gay rights, Aileen Ryan and Thomas Cuite died, Gay rights activist Tom Doerr died
5.Lavender Health, Interview with Dr. Harold Kooden of the Lesbian and Gay Mental Health Advisory Group
6.Closing credits
The Right Stuff:
1.Naming Names, criticism of Senator Gordon Humphrey of New Hampshire who criticized Regan's appointment of Dr. Frank Lilly to his AIDS panel

2.Media Watch, Interviews with Dan Sauso, Lisa Heft and Ron from The Names Project
COMMERCIAL: The Islanders Club
3.Show Bitz, discussion about Charles Bush's play, Psycho Beach Party
4.Inside Out, discussion about "lightness" in commercial products.
COMMERCIAL: Manscape
5. Introduction of Lyle's Deck, a gay resort on South Padre Island, Texas

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, David Strah, Jim Levin and guest Dr. Frank Lilly, only opendly gay member of the presidential commission on AIDS, sponsored by the Human Rights Campaign Fund
2.Dr. Frank Lilly goes into detail about the reasons for his selection and the commissions mandate among other things.
COMMERCIAL: San Francisco AIDS Foundation
3.Continuation of interview with Dr. Frank Lily
COMMERCIAL: Human Rights Campaign Fund
4. Dr. Burton Lee meets with AIDS activists
5.News Watch,Stirling Colgate has developed a software that projects levels of AIDS infection
6.Meridian, Mississipi citizens protest the existence of a local gay bar called Poppers
7. University of California doctor is testing a drug to help with impotency.
8.Article on lesbianism in magazine called, "New Woman"
9. Announcement regarding the October 11th March on Washington
COMMERCIAL:First Hand
10.GCN Sports interviews bowler Gutter George from [VBL]
11. Lavender Health, Interview with Ellen Zaltzberg, an Education Coordinator of the Office of Gay and Lesbian Health Concerns of the NYC Department of Health, talks about homophobia
12.Closing credits
The Right Stuff:
1.Show Bitz, interview with Charles Bush
COMMERCIAL:Manscape
2.Naming Names, "Money Magazine" recieves criticism after publishing an article about a gay couple's finances
COMMERCIAL:The Islanders Club
3.Just Ask Raz,Announcement about play, "Love Goddess" among other things
COMMERCIAL:The Monster
4.Inside Out, Introducing Paco Rabanne
5.Media Watch, Interview with Arthur Kirson, Cabaret Performer

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, Jim Levin, Joyce Hunter, Eleanor Cooper, and guest Tom Duane, Chelsa Democratic District Leader, sponsored by the Human Rights Campaign Fund
2. Footage and rememberance of civil rights and gay activist, Bayard Rustin
3.Discussion and criticism of the Regan AIDS Commission
4.Discussion about an incident in Florida where a house was burned because three HIV positive children lived there
COMMERCIAL:San Francisco AIDS Foundation
5. Discussion about housing rights for surviving partners of AIDS victims
COMMERCIAL: Human Rights Campaign Fund
6.Further discussion about Bayard Rustin
7.Discussion about the October 11th March on Washington
8.News Watch, Soviet Union tests people suspected of having HIV
9.Rosemary Denman, Methodist minister, was suspended by ministry for being openly gay
10.STD Clinic in Seattle Washington makes a greeting card/gift certificate for an AIDS Test
11.NY Gay Community Center sponsors its first orientation
12.GCN Sports, Footage of gymnasts Scott Johnson, Tim Daggett, and Casimiro Suarez
13.Lavender Health, Interview with Richard Heyl from Orientation NYC
14.Closing credits
The Right Stuff:
1.Show Bitz, Review of the cabaret show, Phillip Officer
COMMERCIAL:Gay Treasures
2.Naming Names, criticism of "Associated Press" obituary for Bayard Rustin for the omission of his gay civil rights work
COMMERCIAL:The Islanders Club
3.John Dietrich, from The Islanders Club, talks about the upcoming cruise
COMMERCIAL:The Monster
4.Media Watch, Interview with Leonard J. Martelli and Bill Messina, authors of "When Someone You Know Has AIDS"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm and special guests Denise Alexander, Ortez Alderson, Phillip Reed and Dr. Marjorie Hill, sponsored by the Human Rights Campaign Fund
2.Discussion about race relations in the gay and lesbian political movement
COMMERCIAL:National March on Washington for Lesbian and Gay Rights
3.Discussion about the issues of black gay and lesbians
COMMERCIAL:National March on Washington for Lesbian and Gay Rights
4.Criticism about the Pope and his views on homosexuality and AIDS
5.Washington Countdown, discussion about political candidates who have supported the march
6.Announcement about The Names Project
7.Guests Tom Stoddard (Lambda Legal Defense) and Tim Sweeney (Gay Men's Health Crisis) discuss anti-discriminatory policies in regards to AIDS
8.News Watch, Chicago doctor has been restored to his duties
9.ACLU called upon Regan to reconsider his Advisory AIDS Commission
10.Dr. Robert Gallo, co-discoverer of the AIDS virus, has blasted pharmacetual companies for not taking a bigger inititative in research development
11.Amsterdam developed a monument for Lesbians and Gays
12.Lavender Heatlh, interview with Shelly Neiderbach, founder of the Crime Victims Counseling Services Unit
13.Closing Credits
The Right Stuff:
1.Media Watch, Interview with Eric Perez of the Third World People of Color Caucas
COMMERCIAL:The Islanders Club
2.Perry Brass, "Short Bits of Wisdom From Daddy"
3.Just Ask Raz
COMMERCIAL: Gay Treasures
4.Jeanne Leonard talks about her tribute to Judy Garland
COMMERCIAL:The Monster
5.Interview with Jim Hubbard from the NY Lesbian & Gay Experimental Film Festival

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content

Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Gay Week in Review, with Jim Levin, David Strah, and Christopher Lynn, sponsored by the Human Rights Campaign Fund
2.Discussion about how AIDS affects the classroom and the court room
COMMERCIAL:National March on Washington for Lesbian and Gay Rights
3. Discussion about convicting a man dying of AIDS who robbed a woman
COMMERCIAL:Human Rights Campaign
4.NYC Council nominates Joseph Lisa for Health Committee Chair
5.Washington Countdown, discussion about political candidates and celebrities who are supporting the March on Washington
6. Interview with Susan Cavin and David Harris who talk about Non Violent Civil Disobedience
7.Fundraiser for the March on Washington at The Tunnel
COMMERCIAL:National March on Washington for Lesbian and Gay Rights
8.News Watch, Initial trials of the drug DDC have been stopped because its too toxic
Brendan O'Rourke, an AIDS patient, recieved a hug from Pope John Paul II
9.Anti-Censorship groups have accuseed the National Broadcasting Company for refusing to air a commercial about the US Constitution because of veiled references to abortion and homosexuality
10.GCN Sports, Information about NY Gay Pool League, Interleague meeting regarding gay bowling, and discussion about football strike among other things
11.Lavender Health, Interview with West Cronk, NY Coordinator of the Names Project and NY Steering Committee for the March on Washington
12.Closing Credits
The Right Stuff:
1.Naming Names, criticism of the appointment of Judge Robert Bork for the Supreme Court
COMMERCIAL:The Islanders Club
2.Show Bitz, Discussion about revivial production of "Dreamgirls"
COMMERCIAL: Gay Treasures
3.Cindy and Leah talk about The Fetish Ball at The Limelight

[Air Date: 10/6/1987]: October 1987

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, Jim Levin, Joyce Hunter and Allen Roskoff, sponsored by the Human Rights Campaign Fund
2.Discussion about the events at the March on Washington
COMMERCIAL: Human Rights Campaign Fund Dinner
3.Discussion about presidential candidates and nomination of Robert Bork for the Supreme Court
4.White House comes out against Federal AIDS discrimination legislation and Federal AIDS Comission fires its executive director
COMMERCIAL:Human Rights Campaign Fund Dinner
5.Surgeon General member C. Everett Koop, M.D. talks about condoms and anal sex
6.Washington Countdown, Information about the March on Washington and announcements about National Lobby Days
7.Interview with Vivian Shapiro and Tom Duane who talk about the reasons they are going to the March on Washington
COMMERCIAL: National March on Washington for Lesbian and Gay Rights
8.Regan is backing away from commitment to publish an AIDS pamphlet
9.Playgirl magazine will reinsert full male nudity into its centerfold
10.Gay Community Focus, God's Love We Deliver brings hot meals to AIDS patients
11.The Fund for Human Dignity has recieved a grant to update its National AIDS Resources Directory
12.GCN Sports, Discussion about Keith Hernandez and Phil McConkey
13.Lavender Health, AIDS Surveillance Update, Discussion about the incidence of AIDS in NYC, AIDS Diagnosis Over Time By Risk (Combined Race and Sex), AIDS cases per month among other statistics
13.Closing Credits
The Right Stuff:
1.Naming Names, criticism of Archbishop John Foley who called AIDS a natural sanction
COMMERCIAL:Gay Treasures
2.Show Bitz, Interview with Connie Shulman of the play, "Steel Magnolias"
COMMERCIAL:The Monster
3.Razor Sharp, talks about straight sleeze and condoms among other things
COMMERCIAL:Human Rights Campaign Fund Dinner
4."Short Bits of Wisdom from Daddy" by Perry Brass
COMMERCIAL:The Islanders Club
5.John Dietrich from The Islanders Club talks about the upcoming cruise.
6.Closing Credits

did.unittitle:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 42 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 10/13/1987]

dao.xlink:title: [1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 42 [2]--The Right Stuff<lb/>[Air Date: 10/13/1987]

daodesc.p:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 42 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 10/13/1987]: October 1987

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, Jim Levin, David Strah, and Michael Hirsch, sponsored by the Human Rights Campaign Fund
2.Discussion about gay personal relationships
COMMERCIAL:Human Rights Campaign Fund Dinner
3.Discussion about ACT-UP and the changing face of gay activism
COMMERCIAL: Human Rights Campaign Fund Dinner
4.Discussion about the conservative publication, "The Wanderer."
5.News Watch, State of California passed bills to allow tests to treat AIDS
6.Representative Gerry Studs demands an investigation on the failure of the Regan administration to properly deal with AIDS and AIDS education
7.British Medical Journal states that the HIV Virus Antibody tests can take up to 14 months for a detection
8.Milwaukee gay community protests radio station WQFM for homophobic radio show
9.Announcements about LGBT events
10.GCN Sports, Soccer team, The Ramblers win a game in Boston, Football player Rich [Syler] faces charges of second degree murder,Virgin Islands announces that they are going to field a team for the 1988 Winter Olympics
11.Lavender Heatlh, interview with Don Lorimer, Lower East Side AIDS Coordinator
12.Closing Credits
The Right Stuff:
1.Show Bitz, discussion about the gay play, "What's New"
COMMERCIAL:The Islanders Club
2.Naming Names, criticism about the portrayal of a gay character in the movie, "No Way Out"
COMMERCIAL:Human Rights Campaign Fund Dinner
COMMERCIAL:The Monster
3.Razor Sharp, talks about the play, "20's, 30's, 40's", The Fetish Ball, and Raw Hide
COMMERCIAL:Gay Treasures
4.GCN soap opera, "Georgia Vice," episode "Georgia Vice's Day Off"
COMMERCIAL:The Monster
5. "Short Bits of Wisdom From Daddy" by Perry Brass
6.Closing Credits

accessrestrict.p: Available for viewing by appointment only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm
2.National March on Washington for Lesbian and Gay Rights
3.Brent Nicholson Earle, The American Run to End AIDS
4.Harvey Milk memorial, Never Forget
5.Let Freedom Ring, Benefit concert produced by the Lesbian and Gay Bands of America and speech by MA. Representative, Hon. Gerry Studds at the D.A.R. Constitution Hall
COMMERCIAL:The Islanders Club
6.The Wedding, interview with a couples getting married at the March on Washington
COMMERCIAL:The Monster
7.Footage and interviews from The Names Project presentation at the March on Washington
8.Footage and interviews from the March on Washington
9.March on Washington Rally featuring Rev. Jesse Jackson
COMMERCIAL:Gay Treasures
10.Continuation of March on Washington Rally featuring Rev. Jesse Jackson

[Air Date: 10/28/1987]

daodesc.p:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 44 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 10/28/1987]: October 1987

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, Marie Manion, Arthur W. Strickler, and Jeffrey Golding, sponsored by the Human Rights Campaign Fund
2.Discussion about the Gay and Lesbian March on Washington
COMMERCIAL:Human Rights Campaign
3.Discussion about how the press represented the Gay and Lesbian March on Washington
COMMERCIAL:Village Pointe Condos
4.Andy Humm reflects upon his experience at The Names Project
5.News Watch, Philadelphia organization, [Les Femmes] falsly advertised a all lesbian cruise to Bermuda
6.Discussion about Shere Hite's book, "Woman and Love: A Cultural Revolution in Progress"
7.Announcement about Lesbian nightclub events and New York City Gay Men's Chorus Halloween Party
8.Footage from the Human Rights Campaign Dinner where Nathan Kolodor, President of Board, GMHC awarded Larry Kramer the arts award
9.Lavender Health, Footage from the film, "AIDS Changing the Rules"
10.Closing Credits
The Right Stuff:
1.Show Bitz, discussion about the gay play, "Farm Boys"
COMMERCIAL:Gay Treasures
2.Naming Names, criticism regarding the AIDS misinformation in William F. Buckley Jr. article in The Daily News
3.Razor Sharp talks about the film "Too Outrageous," The Pyramid Club, and Halloween
4."Short Bits of Wisdom From Daddy" by Perry Brass
COMMERCIAL:Village Pointe Condos
5.Rosa von Praunheim interviews Craig Russell from the film, "Too Outrageous"
6.Inside Out, Episode, "Bruce's Dungeon on the Lake."
6.Closing Credits

did.unittitle:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 45 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 11/3/1987]

daodesc.p:
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 45 [2]--The Right Stuff
[Air Date: 11/3/1987]: November 1987

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, Jim Levin, Joyce Hunter and special guest Harvey Fierstein, sponsored by the Human Rights Campaign Fund
2.Discussion about Senator Jesse Helms who attacked educational comics from the Gay Men's Heatlh Crisis
COMMERCIAL: San Francisco AIDS Foundation
3.Discussion about Randy Shilts book, "And the Band Played On"
COMMERCIAL:Human Rights Campaign Fund
4.Discussion about PBS's show, "AIDS Changing the Rules" hosted by President Regan's son, Ronald Regan Jr.
5.News Watch, Provincton, MA town crier has been asked to resign because of homophobic remarks
6.AIDS Drugs Assistance program
7.David Engel, actor in "La Cage Aux Follies" sues Worthington's photography company for not including him and his partner Eric Underwood in their alumni memory book
8.Gay Community Calendar, announcements about upcoming events
9.GCN Sports, Front Runners Benefit Run, Announcements about Pool matches, Gay Indoor Soccer League, Gynmist,Tim Daggett, broke his leg
10.Lavender Health, Interview with Michael Shernoff from Chelsea Psychotherapy Associates
11.Closing Credits
The Right Stuff:
1.Show Bitz, Interview with Will Sheffer from the play, "Fortune in Men's Eyes"
COMMERCIAL:The Monster
2."Short Bits of Wisdom From Daddy" by Perry Brass
3.Interview with Bill Kunkel from Village Pointe Condos
COMMERCIAL:San Francisco AIDS Foundation
4.Part 2 of Rosa von Praunheim's interview with Craig Russell from the film, "Too Outrageous"
COMMERCIAL:Gay Treasures
5.Closing Credits

[Air Date: 3/24/1988]: March 1988

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, Phil Zwickler, Michael Petrelis, Philip Reed, and Tom Duane, sponsored by the Human Rights Campaign Fund
2.Discussion about research team Masters and Johnson who is working on a spermicide that would kill HIV
3.Discussion about the Arts Council funding LGBT art projects
COMMERCIAL:The World:Benefit AIDS Resource Center
4. Interview with Michael Petrelis who led a delegation of activists to various states during primary elections called, Freedom Ride
5.Tom Duane talks about Housing Rights of LGBT people
COMMERCIAL:Night of 1,000 Gowns
6.Al [Hears],video artist at Gay Cable Network dies of AIDS, Andy Humm reflects upon his activism
COMMERCIAL:The "A" Party Line
7.News Watch, The U.S Office of Personnel Management announces AIDS policy that prohibits discrimination against employees with AIDS
8.Vermont Bill addresses housing discrimination against LGBT people
9.Boulder, CO lesbian wins approval to adopt a child
10.Spotlight on Lesbians, Interview with author Karla Jay
COMMERCIAL:The Party Line for Men
11.Lavender Health, Interview with Dr. Barbara Warren director of Project Connect
12.Closing Credits
COMMERCIAL:The "A" Party Line
COMMERCIAL:Gay Cable Network show, "Be My Guest" with Sybil Ophthalmia Bruncheon
COMMERCIAL:Men's Party Line
The Right Stuff:
1.Naming Names, criticism against The New York Post's negative article on the New York State Council on the Arts, which funded LGBT art projects
COMMERCIAL:Village Pointe Condos
2.Razor Sharp talks about the closing of NYC club, The Saint
COMMERCIAL:The Party Line for Men
3.Media Watch, Interview with Larry Kadish, Curator of the Film Department at MOMA talks about the film festival, New Directors/New Films

[Air Date: 8/25/1988]: August 1988

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
Special Episode: Coverage of 1988 Republican and Democratic National Conventions â highlights:
COMMERCIAL: The "Tyte" Party Line, for men only
1. History of gay rights movement.
2. On RNC floor, interviews with Evan Meecham, Al D'Amato, John Roberts, Jim Fenalson, Jonathan Bush, Henry Kissinger, and Marvin Bush, who are questioned about political issues affecting the gay community.
3. At DNC, interviews with Sgt. Perry Watkins, Karen Clark, Mike Farrell, Martin Hiraga, and Ted Weiss, who are questioned about political issues affecting the gay community.
COMMERCIAL: Gay Pride Parade & Christopher Street Festival 1988 video
4. Interview with Urvashi Vaid.
COMMERCIAL: 550-9000, presented by the Megaquest Group
5. NO/AIDS Task Force Resource Center discusses the AIDS crisis and progress.
COMMERCIAL: 550-GAYS
6. Anti-gay followers of Pat Robertson harass gay rights activists at a gay rights rally at Lafayette Square.
COMMERCIAL: The "Tyte" Party Line, for men only
7. RNC attendees react to ACTUP demonstration/counter-demonstration.
COMMERCIAL: Village Pointe Condos
8. At the RNC, interview with Angela Buchanan who talks about children being taught about the "gay lifestyle".
COMMERCIAL: 550-9000, presented by the Megaquest Group
9. At RNC, interviews with correspondents of non-gay news outlets.
COMMERCIAL: 550-GAYS
10. At RNC, attendees discuss their support of George H.W. Bush; Urvashi Vaid discusses her opposition to Bush.
COMMERCIAL: Gay Pride Parade & Christopher Street Festival 1988 video
COMMERCIAL: The "Tyte" Party Line, for men only

dao.xlink:title: [1]--Pride and Progress [2]--The Right Stuff; San Francisco No. 51, 1/27

daodesc.p: [1]--Pride and Progress [2]--The Right Stuff; San Francisco No. 51, 1/27: Undated

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress: San Francisco
1. With William Casey, Kory McCormack, and Cheryl Rosenthal
2.Scientists have discovered AIDS drug AZT and vaccine
3.Two men chained themselves to county building after supervisors refused to allocate $50,000 for AIDS services
4.Insurance compoany, Blue Cross has reimbursed patient for experimental AIDS treatments
5.Colorado law makers trying to pass law to quarantine, test, and trace people suspected of being infected with AIDS
6.Sacramento, CA jury selection for a case where four defendents from The Citizens for Medical Justice blocked the entrance of the governsors office who refused to meet and sign law AB3407, which would help protect people sufferening from AIDS
7.Wesley Johnson in Oregon prison was punished for kissing the hand of a visitor
COMMERCIAL:Special Valentines Message from GCN
8.Behind the Scenes at GCN
8.COMMERCIAL: Shari Belafonte: San Francisco AIDS Foundation
9.News Week Magazine features a condom advertisement
10.San Francisco Supervisor, Harry Britt address condom advertisments and talks about condoms and risk
11.Great Britain Secretary of State was in San Franciso touring facilities with people with AIDS
12.Nello Carlini interviews Tighe Foley from the Shanti Project
13.San Francisco police department meets with the gay community to talk about safety in regards to socializing, Dianne Christianson from C.U.A.V. talks about safety when leaving bars
14.Sonoma has included AIDS discrimination legislation
COMMERCIAL:Special Valentines Message from GCN
15.COMMERCIAL: Mikhail Baryshnikov, Shanti Project
COMMERCIAL:San Francisco AIDS Foundation
16. Dr. Nancy Shaw sues University of California because of denied tenure
17.Sally Gearhart Commentary, discussion about the gym
18.GCN Announces 1 Year Anniversary
19.Closing Credits
The Right Stuff:
1. With Danny Williams, talks about GCN's 1st Anniversary
COMMERCIAL:Special Valentines Message
2.This Week in Gay History with Jeff Bixby
3.Footage of GCN 1 Year Anniversary Party featuring Tom Ammiano, Danny Williams, Laurie Bushman, and Mario Mondelli
4. Interview with Mike Hippler from Bay Area Reporter (BAR)
5.Ms. Leather San Francisco Footage
6.Closing Credits

daodesc.p: [1]--Pride and Progress [2]--The Right Stuff; Vol. IV No. 46, San Francisco No. 52: Undated

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress: San Francisco
News â highlights:
1. With Casey Ward and Korey McCormack
2. GCN celebrates its 1st anniversary.
3. Ward and McCormack discuss recent events affecting the gay and lesbian community.
4. Happy Valentine's Day, from GCN
COMMERCIAL: SF AIDS Foundation
5. Ward and McCormack continue discussing recent events.
6. Discussion of a West Virginia Supreme Court case regarding a lesbian teacher
7. Interview with Irene Smith, massage therapist for people with AIDS
8. Speakers with San Francisco AIDS Foundation discuss impact of AIDS on women.
9. Report on Bishop William E. Swing regarding church liturgies for same-sex unions.
10. Report on Dutch National Broadcasting Corporation creation of gay and lesbian [teletext] service.
The Right Stuff:
1. With Karen Ripley
2. This Week in Gay History with Jeff Bixby
3. Happy Valentine's Day, from GCN
COMMERCIAL: Shanti Project, with Michael and Paula Smuin
4. Interview with Nancy Yerby, who talks about macrobiotic nutrition
5. Interview with Michael Prince, who talks about his music career and his single "Dance Your Love Away". Includes clip of music video.
6. Happy Valentine's Day, from GCN
7. Karen Ripley being comedic
8. Promotion of "Poetry & Well-Being" to benefit ACL's free art classes for people with AIDS
9. Interview with Frank Pike, who talks about his business Moonlighting Escorts.
10. Just Ask Raz
COMMERCIAL: Cook's Magazine
COMMERCIAL: The Best of "Money, Money, Money"

1. This Week in Gay History with Jeff Bixby
COMMERCIAL: EZ-Trim
2. As I See It with Prince Pannece. Includes clip of film "Desert Hearts".
COMMERCIAL: NGTF Fund for Human Dignity with "Dear Abby" Abigail Van Buren
3. Introduction by hosts Doris Fish and Tippi
COMMERCIAL: R. Kassman, Purveyor of Fine Pianos
4. M. G. Whitney, Speed Talk Institute
5. Doris Fish and Tippi introduce David Nahmod
6. David Nahmod discusses new films and shows in San Francisco
7. Doris Fish and Tippi introduce Dr. Farkle
8. Ask Dr. Farkle
9. Doris Fish and Tippi introduce a clip from the film "Just Another Girl"
COMMERCIAL: SF AIDS Foundation
10. Doris Fish and Tippi show items they bought shopping.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress: San Francisco
1. With Joseph Durant and Cheryl Rosenthal
COMMERCIAL:Professional Glass
COMMERCIAL:Dionne Warwick:San Francisco AIDS Foundation
2.Pacific Bell must pay 3 million dollar settlement due to gay employment discrimination, Footage of Jean O'Leary from NGRA
3.AB1 bill prevents bias on job discrimination
4.Salvation Army works and provides funds towards anti-gay legislation, Footage of Steven Rasher, GGBA
5.Law-suit has been served to Women's Training Center for sex bias
6.Gay Games Board of Directors presented awards to volunteers, Footage of speech by Rikki Streiker, GGII Treasurer
7. Interview with Karen Thompson who talks about the denial of her rights to take care of her diabled partner
8.Interview with Paul Wotman who talks about living wills regarding gay and lesbian partnerships
9.Dr. Harvey Thompson, an early educator of AIDS health, died.
10.Sally Gearhart talks about her only religious expeience
COMMERCIAL:Professional Glass
11.Mario Mandelli:GCN Fundraising
12.Carol Migden, Chair S.F. Demo Party: GCN Fundraising
13.Nello Carlini:GCN Fundraising
14.Pride and Progress, with Doug Kimball, Football results of San Francisco Trojans defeat over The Deputies
15.Tom Matthews talks about male circumcision
16.Closing Credits
The Right Stuff:
1. With Mario Mandelli
COMMERCIAL:Rip Taylor: San Francisco AIDS Foundation
2.This Week in Gay History with Kevin Sweeney
3.Interview with Eric Gilbert who talks about "Gay Comix"
4.Footage and interviews from a Lily Thomlin and Jane Wagner book signing
COMMERCIAL: Baybrick Inn
5. Interview with Joann Loulan author of "Lesbian Sex"
COMMERCIAL:Baybrick Inn
6.Karen Ripley:GCN Fundraising
7.Danny Williams:GCN Fundraising
COMMERCIAL:Blazing Redheads
8.Joan Rivers Impersonator: GCN Fundraising
9. Jimmy Romer, City Gossip
10.Closing Credits

daodesc.p: [1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 34 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. [Air Date: 9/9/1984]: September 1984

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p:
Pride and Progress
News-highlights:
1. Alexandria, Virginia, Phillip W. Smalley says illicit homosexual remarks as a joke and receives arrest warrant for solicitation and sodomy, potentially faces 5 years in prison
2. Three United State Court of Appeals judges uphold Temple University discriminatory lower court ruling
3. San Francisco gay man on trial for battery and resisting arrest, pleads not guilty
4. South Carolina pornography laws
COMMERCIAL: SF AIDS Foundation
5. Superior court judge voids ban on bathhouse sex
6. Reagan Republican National Committee spends large sum for California GOP candidate
7. Dr. Silverman, Former Head of San Francisco Public Health and Robin Williams hold press conference opposing proposition 64, includes coverage
8. Metropolitan Church Committee wins right to hold religious services for prisoners
9. Lesbian Caucus holds 2nd annual blood drive, to benefit AIDS patients
10. Mishi Cohen, director of Quan Yin Acupuncture, discusses alternative medicine and AIDS research
11. Sally Gearhart commentary
12. AIDS Bills, AB3667, FB1327, AB31237, AB33233, and AB4249
13. Gay Father's Coalition changes name to The Gay and Lesbian Parents Association International
14. AIDS victim Mark Siegel dies
15. California Closing credits
16. Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Michael Shernoff discusses his Safer Sex Workshop
17. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:
1. This Week in Gay History with Jeff Bixby
COMMERCIAL: "Manscape," a gay magazine
COMMERCIAL: Terry Miller, Different Life Bookshop
COMMERCIAL: SF AIDS Foundation
2. Current events/media/culture, includes clips
COMMERCIAL: Interart Theatre
3. Cooking with Esther
4. Closing credits

did.unittitle: Series XXIX: Lou Maletta and GCN Files

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series contains the paper materials of the Gay Cable Network Archive. It includes Lou Maletta's files, press clippings, program guides, and other materials related to the collection.
